Description: AGRICULTURE AND FISHING
AGRICULTURE AND RELATED SERVICE ACTIVITIES
GROWING OF CROPS, MARKET GARDENING AND HORTICULTURE
Growing of Food Crops (Non-Hydroponics)
Growing of leafy and fruit vegetables
Definition: This sub-class includes the cultivation of leafy or fruit vegetables by propagating in solid media (e.g. traditional or synthetic soil).

Description: Growing of mushrooms
Definition: This sub-class includes the cultivation of mushrooms by propagating in solid media (e.g. traditional or synthetic soil).

Description: Growing of root crops
Definition: This sub-class includes the cultivation of root crops by propagating in solid media (e.g. traditional or synthetic soil).

Description: Growing of food crops (non-hydroponics) n.e.c.
Definition: This sub-class includes the propagation of food crops in solid media (e.g. traditional or synthetic soil) that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•cereals growing (non-hydroponics)
•rice growing (non-hydroponics)
•bulb vegetable growing (non-hydroponics)

Description: Growing of Food Crops (Hydroponics)
Growing of leafy and fruit vegetables (hydroponics)
Definition: This sub-class includes the cultivation of leafy or fruit vegetables by placing the roots in liquid media.

Description: Growing of Fruits
Growing of fruits
Definition: This Sub-class includes growing of fruits such as banana, papaya, mangoes, dates or pineapples.

Description: Growing of Nursery Products
Growing of orchids
Definition: This Sub-class includes growing of orchids.

Description: Growing of ornamental plants
Definition: This Sub-class includes growing of ornamental plants.

Description: Growing of nursery products n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes growing of nursery products not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•aquarium plant growing
•tissue culture plantlet

Description: Growing of Other Crops
Growing of other crops
Definition: This Sub-class includes the growing of other crops such as coconuts, oil palm, tobacco or rubber.

Description: ANIMAL PRODUCTION
Livestock Production (except Poultry and Animal Specialties)
Pig farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes rearing of pigs.

Description: Cattle farms (including dairy cattle)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•rearing of cattle
•production of raw cow milk from cows

Description: Goat farms (including goat's milk production)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes: 
•rearing of sheep or goat
•production of milk from sheep or goat.

Description: Poultry Farms and Hatcheries
Poultry breeding/hatcheries
Definition: This Sub-class includes farms and hatcheries that are primarily engaged in rearing of poultry such as chickens, ducks and geese.

Description: Broiler farms (chickens reared for meat)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the rearing of chickens for meat.

Description: Layer farms (chickens reared for eggs)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•rearing of chickens for eggs
•production of eggs from chickens

Description: Duck farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes rearing of ducks for meat or eggs.

Description: Other Animal Production
Dog breeding
Definition: This Sub-class includes raising and breeding of dogs.

Description: Bird breeding
Definition: This Sub-class includes raising and breeding of birds.

Description: Crocodile farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes farms that raise and breed crocodiles.

Description: Frog farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes farms that raise and breed frogs.

Description: Other animal production n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes raising and breeding of animals not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•insect breeding
•rabbit breeding
•hamster breeding
•apiary (bee-keeping), including production of honey and beeswax

Description: GROWING OF CROPS COMBINED WITH ANIMAL PRODUCTION (MIXED FARMING)
Growing of Crops Combined with Animal Production (Mixed Farming)
Growing of crops combined with animal production (mixed farming)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the combined production of crops and animals without a specialised production of crops or animals. The size of the overall farming operation is not a determining factor. If either production of crops or animals in a given unit exceeds 66 percent of standard gross margins, the combined activity should not be included here, but allocated to crop or animal farming.

Description: AGRICULTURAL AND ANIMAL HUSBANDRY SERVICE ACTIVITIES EXCEPT VETERINARY ACTIVITIES
Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Service Activities (except Veterinary Activities)
Agricultural and animal husbandry service activities except veterinary activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes agricultural and animal husbandry services such as collection of agricultural and animal husbandry by-products (e.g. chicken feathers, palm leaves). The provision of agricultural equipment together with the services of drivers and other attendants of equipment is also covered in this Sub-class. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following activities:
•herd testing services
•poultry caponising
•coop cleaning
•sheep shearing
•preparation of crops for primary markets by cleaning, trimming, grading or disinfecting
•cotton ginning
•waxing of fruits
•sun-drying of fruits or vegetables 
•seed processing for propagation

Description: FORESTRY, LOGGING AND RELATED SERVICE ACTIVITIES
FORESTRY, LOGGING AND RELATED SERVICE ACTIVITIES
Forestry, Logging and Related Service Activities
Forestry, logging and related service activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the extraction, gathering and production of round wood for the forest-based manufacturing industries. Besides the production of timber, forestry activities result in products that undergo little processing, such as fire wood, charcoal, wood chips and round wood used in an unprocessed form (e.g. pit-props, pulpwood). These activities can be carried out in natural or planted forests. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•growing of standing timber: 
- planting
- replanting
- transplanting
- thinning
- conserving of forests and timber tracts 
•growing of pulpwood 
•operation of forest tree nurseries
•production of round wood
•gathering and production of fire wood
•production of charcoal in the forest (using traditional methods)

Description: FISHING, OPERATION OF FISH HATCHERIES AND FISH FARMS; SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCIDENTAL TO FISHING
FISHING
Fishing
Fishing in kelongs
Definition: This Sub-class includes commercial fishing in kelongs directed at removing or collecting live fish, molluscs (e.g. mussels and oysters), crustaceans or plants (e.g. sea weeds) for human consumption and other purposes by hand or various types of fishing gear such as nets, lines or stationary traps.

Description: Ocean fishing except fishing in kelongs
Definition: This Sub-class includes commercial fishing in oceans directed at removing or collecting live wild fish, molluscs (e.g. mussels and oysters), crustaceans or plants (e.g. sea weeds) for human consumption and other purposes by hand, commercially made boats or various types of fishing gear such as nets, lines or stationary traps.

Description: Coastal fishing except fishing in kelongs
Definition: This Sub-class includes commercial fishing in coastal waters, directed at removing or collecting live wild fish, molluscs (e.g. mussels and oysters), crustaceans or plants (e.g. sea weeds) for human consumption and other purposes by hand or various types of fishing gear such as nets, lines or stationary traps.

Description: Fishing n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes fishing activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•natural pearl gathering
•sea sponge gathering
•coral gathering

Description: OPERATION OF FISH HATCHERIES AND FISH FARMS
Fish Farming
Food fish farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes farms that rear marine or freshwater fish for food.

Description: Ornamental fish farms
Definition: This Sub-class includes marine or freshwater ornamental fish farms.

Description: Operation of fish hatcheries and fish farms n.e.c. (including turtle, prawn, crab, mussel farms)
Definition: This Sub-class includes aquafarming activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•fish hatcheries
•mussel farm
•prawn farm

Description: MINING AND QUARRYING
MINING AND QUARRYING
QUARRYING OF STONE, SAND AND CLAY
Quarrying of Stone, Sand and Clay
Stone quarrying
Definition:
This Sub-class includes extraction of building or monumental stone from the earth.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•quarrying, rough trimming or sawing of monumental or building stone (e.g. marble, granite, sandstone, slate)
•quarrying, crushing or breaking of limestone
•mining of gypsum, anhydrite, chalk or uncalcined dolomite
•extraction or dredging of gravel
•breaking or crushing of stone or gravel

Description: Quarrying of sand and clay
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•extraction of ceramic, refractory or other clay from the earth
•extraction of sand from the earth.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•extraction or dredging of industrial sand or sand from construction
•quarrying of sand

Description: OTHER MINING AND QUARRYING
Other Mining and Quarrying
Other mining and quarrying
Definition:
This Sub-class includes mining and quarrying of other minerals, except for stone, sand and clay.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•mining of:
- metal ores
- thorium ores
- non-ferrous metal ores (e.g. aluminium (bauxite), copper, lead, zinc, tin, manganese)
- coal
- lignite
- chemicals 
- fertiliser minerals
•extraction of peat uranium or salt 
•mining and quarrying of various minerals or materials such as abrasive materials, asbestos or siliceous fossils meals

Description: SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCIDENTAL TO OIL AND GAS EXTRACTION (EXCLUDING SURVEYING AND ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSULTANCY SERVICES SUPPORTING MINING, OIL AND GAS EXTRACTION AND OFFSHORE EXPLORATION ACTIVITIES)

SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCIDENTAL TO OIL AND GAS EXTRACTION (EXCLUDING SURVEYING AND ENGINEERING DESIGN AND CONSULTANCY SERVICES SUPPORTING MINING, OIL AND GAS EXTRACTION AND OFFSHORE EXPLORATION ACTIVITIES)

Service Activities Incidental to Oil and Gas Extraction (excluding Surveying and Engineering Design and Consultancy Services Supporting Mining, Oil and Gas Extraction and Offshore Exploration Activities)
Crude petroleum and natural gas production
Definition:
This Sub-class includes extraction, exploration, dressing or beneficiating of crude petroleum and natural gas.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•extraction or exploration of crude petroleum oils, gaseous hydrocarbon (natural gas) or condensates 
•draining or separation of liquid hydrocarbon fractions
•gas desulphurisation
•extraction or exploration of bituminous or oil shale or tar sand
•production of crude petroleum from bituminous shale or sand
•processes to obtain crude oils such as decantation, desalting, dehydration or stabilisation
•mining of hydrocarbon liquid, obtained through liquefaction or pyrolysis

Description: Service activities incidental to oil and gas extraction (excluding surveying and engineering design and consultancy services supporting mining, oil and gas extraction and offshore exploration activities)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes oil and gas field service support activities such as:
•directional drilling or redrilling
•cementing oil or gas well casings
•pumping, plugging or abandoning wells

Description: MANUFACTURING
MANUFACTURE OF FOOD PRODUCTS
PROCESSING AND PRESERVING OF MEAT
Processing and Preserving of Meat
Slaughtering of livestock and poultry
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the operation of slaughterhouses engaged in killing, dressing or packing meat: beef, pork, lamb, mutton, poultry, etc.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the production of fresh, chilled or frozen meat in carcasses, cuts or in individual portions.

Description: Manufacture of sausage
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of sausages or salami.

Description: Preparing, canning and preserving of livestock and livestock products (including lard and other edible animal fats)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the preparation of processed meat or meat by-products: beef, pork, lamb, mutton, etc.
•rendering of lard or other edible fats of animal origin. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the production of:
•dried, salted or smoked meat: beef, pork, lamb, mutton, etc. 
•meat products like puddings, pâtés, rillettes, boiled ham
•hides or skins originating from slaughterhouses, including fellmongery and pulled wool

Description: Preparing, canning and preserving of poultry and poultry products
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the preparation of processed poultry or poultry by-products. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the production of:
•dried, salted or smoked poultry
•poultry skins originating from slaughterhouses, including feathers or down

Description: Processing and preserving of meat and meat products n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes processing or preserving of meat or meat products not elsewhere classified.
Examples: •satay manufacturing

Description: PROCESSING AND PRESERVING OF SEAFOOD
Processing and Preserving of Seafood
Processing and preserving of seafood
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•canning of seafood; processing, curing or preserving of seafood by methods other than canning. It also includes the activities of vessels engaged only in the processing or preserving of fish.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•production of:
- fish, crustacean or mollusc products: cooked fish, fish fillets, roes, caviar, caviar substitutes, etc.
- fishmeal for human consumption or animal feed
- meals or solubles from fish or other aquatic animals unfit for human consumption
•preparation or preservation of fish, crustaceans and molluscs: freezing, deep-freezing, drying, smoking, salting, immersing in brine, canning, etc.
•processing of seaweed
•preparation or preservation of fish, crustaceans or molluscs through canning

Description: PROCESSING AND PRESERVING OF FRUITS AND VEGETABLES
Processing and Preserving of Fruits and Vegetables
Manufacture of jams (including fruit jelly)
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture of jams (including fruit jelly), marmalades and table jellies.

Description: Other canning and preserving of fruits and fruit juices
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of food consisting chiefly of fruits, except ready-made dishes in frozen or canned form
•preserving of fruit by freezing, drying, immersing in oil or in vinegar, canning, etc.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•fruit food products
•fruit juices
•concentrates from fresh fruits
•perishable prepared foods of fruit

Description: Other canning and preserving of vegetables and vegetable juices (including pickles)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of food consisting chiefly of vegetables, except ready-made dishes in frozen or canned form
•preserving of nuts or vegetables by freezing, drying, immersing in oil or in vinegar, canning, etc. 
•industrial peeling of potatoes

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•vegetable food products
•vegetable juices
•concentrates from vegetables
•prepared frozen potatoes
•dehydrated mashed potatoes
•potato flour or meal
•nut foods or pastes
•perishable prepared foods of vegetables
•cut or peeled vegetables

Description: MANUFACTURE OF VEGETABLE AND ANIMAL OILS AND FATS
Manufacture of Vegetable and Animal Oils and Fats
Manufacture of edible vegetable and animal oils and fats
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of edible crude or refined oils or fats from vegetables or animal materials, except rendering or refining of lard and other edible animal fats.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•crude vegetable oils: olive oil, soya bean oil, sunflower-seed oil, cotton-seed oil, rapeseed oil, mustard oil, linseed oil, etc.
•non-defatted flour or meal of oilseeds, oil nuts or oil kernels
•refined vegetable oils: olive oil, soya bean oil, etc.
•margarine
•melanges or similar spreads
•compound cooking fats
•crude or refined coconut and palm oil
•processing of vegetable oils: blowing, boiling, dehydration, hydrogenation, etc.
•extraction of fish or marine mammal oils

Description: Manufacture of inedible vegetable and animal oils and fats
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of inedible crude or refined oils and fats from vegetables or animals
•manufacture of cotton linters, oilcakes or other residual products of oil production

Description: Manufacture of vegetable and animal oils and fats n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of vegetable or animal oils and fats not elsewhere classified.
Examples: •animal oil, hydrogenating, excluding edible fats

Description: MANUFACTURE OF DAIRY PRODUCTS
Manufacture of Dairy Products
Manufacture of condensed and evaporated milk (including pasteurising and bottling of fluid milk)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of condensed or evaporated milk (including pasteurising or bottling of fluid milk).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•fresh liquid milk, pasteurised, sterilised, homogenised or ultra heat treated
•milk-based drinks
•cream from fresh liquid milk (pasteurised, sterilised, homogenised)

Description: Manufacture of milk powder
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of milk powder.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•dried or concentrated milk whether or not sweetened
•milk or cream in solid form

Description: Manufacture of ice-cream
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of ice-cream or other edible ice such as sorbet.

Description: Manufacture of dairy products n.e.c. (e.g. butter, cheese, ice-cream mixes and powder, yoghurt)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of dairy products not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•butter manufacturing
•cheese manufacturing
•yoghurt manufacturing

Description: MANUFACTURE OF GRAIN MILL PRODUCTS, STARCHES AND STARCH PRODUCTS
Manufacture of Grain Mill Products
Rice milling
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•rice milling: production of husked, milled, polished, glazed, parboiled or converted rice 
•production of rice flour

Description: Wheat milling
Definition: This Sub-class includes grain milling: production of flour, meal or pellets of wheat, rye, oats, maize (corn) or other cereal grains.

Description: Provision of milling services
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of milling services.

Description: Manufacture of grain mill products n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of grain mill products not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•pepper seed processing
•cereal breakfast foods manufacturing
•flour mixes or prepared blended flour or dough for bread, cakes, biscuits or pancakes manufacturing

Description: Manufacture of Starches and Starch Products
Manufacture of starches and starch products
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of starches or starch products.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•starches from rice, potatoes, maize, etc.
•glucose, glucose syrup, maltose, etc.
•gluten
•tapioca or tapioca substitutes prepared from starch
•corn oil
•wet corn milling

Description: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER FOOD PRODUCTS
Manufacture of Bakery Products
Manufacture of biscuits (including wafers and cones)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of biscuits or other "dry" bakery products (e.g. wafers, cones)
•manufacture of snack products (e.g. cookies, biscuit crackers, pretzels), whether sweet or salted
•manufacture of tortillas

Description: Manufacture of bread, cakes and confectionery (excluding frozen bakery products)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•fresh bread or rolls
•fresh pastry, cakes, pies, tarts, etc.
•preserved pastry goods or cakes (excluding frozen)

Description: Manufacture of bakery products n.e.c.
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of frozen bakery products like:
•pancakes
•waffles
•roti prata

Description: Manufacture of Sugar
Manufacture of sugar and sugar products
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•refining of sugar
•manufacture of:
- sugar substitutes form the juice of cane, beet, maple or palm
- sugar syrups 
- molasses
•production of maple syrup or sugar

Description: Manufacture of Cocoa, Chocolate and Non-chocolate Confectionery
Manufacture of cocoa and chocolate powder from beans
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of cocoa or chocolate powder from beans
•manufacture of cocoa butter, cocoa fat or cocoa oil

Description: Manufacture of chocolate and chocolate products
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of chocolate and chocolate confectionery.

Description: Manufacture of non-chocolate confectionery (e.g. sweets, toffees, crystallised fruits, chewing gums)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of non-chocolate confectionery.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•sugar confectionery: caramels, cachous, nougats, fondant, white chocolate, sweets, toffees
•chewing gum
•confectionery lozenges and pastilles
•preserving in sugar of fruit, nuts, fruit peels or other parts of plants

Description: Manufacture of Macaroni, Noodles, Vermicelli and Other Related Products
Manufacture of macaroni, noodles, vermicelli and other related products
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•pastas such as macaroni or noodles, whether cooked or stuffed
•canned or frozen pasta products

Description: Manufacture of Prepared Meals and Dishes
Manufacture of cooked-food preparations (e.g. frozen dinners)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of ready-made (i.e. prepared, seasoned and cooked) meals or dishes. These dishes are processed to preserve them, such as in frozen or canned form, and are usually packaged and labelled for re-sale, i.e. this class does not include the preparation of meals for immediate consumption, such as in restaurants. To be considered a dish, these foods have to contain at least two distinct main ingredients (except seasonings).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•meat or poultry dishes
•fish dishes, including fish and chips
•prepared dishes of vegetables
•canned stews or vacuum-prepared meals
•other prepared meals (such as "TV dinners")
•frozen or otherwise preserved pizza

Description: Manufacture of Coffee, Tea and Related Products
Manufacture of instant beverages
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of instant beverages, including coffee or tea substitutes.

Description: Processing of coffee seeds
Definition: This Sub-class includes the processing of coffee seeds, including decaffeinating or roasting of coffee.

Description: Manufacture of coffee powder
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of coffee powder including the production of coffee products (e.g. ground coffee, soluble coffee, extracts or concentrates of coffee, instant coffee).

Description: Manufacture of tea (including processing of tea leaves)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of tea (including processing of tea leaves).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in:
•blending of tea or maté
•manufacture of extracts or preparations based on tea or mate
•manufacture of herbal tea
•instant tea
•herb infusions (e.g. mint, chamomile)

Description: Manufacture of non-dairy creamer
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of non-dairy creamer.

Description: Manufacture of Other Food Products n.e.c.
Manufacture of sauces including soya bean sauce (e.g. tomato sauce, chilli sauce)
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture of sauces (e.g. tomato sauce, chilli sauce, soya bean sauce).

Description: Manufacture of soya bean products except soya bean sauce and soya bean milk
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture of soya bean products except soya bean sauce and soya bean milk.

Description: Manufacture and processing of spices (including curry powder and spice extracts)
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture or processing of spices (e.g. curry powder, spice extracts).

Description: Manufacture of chips, crackers and other titbits (excluding biscuits and confectionery)
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture of chips, keropok crackers or other titbits.

Description: Manufacture of other food products n.e.c. (except food chemicals and additives)
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture of other food products not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•vinegar manufacturing
•artificial honey or caramel manufacturing
•perishable prepared foods manufacturing
•yeast manufacturing
•extracts or juices of meat, fish, crustaceans or molluscs manufacturing
•non-dairy milk or cheese substitutes manufacturing
•egg products or egg albumin manufacturing

Description: MANUFACTURE OF PREPARED ANIMAL FEEDS
Manufacture of Prepared Animal Feeds
Manufacture of prepared animal feeds (including additives for animal feed)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•prepared feeds for pets, including dogs, cats, birds, fish
•prepared feeds for farm animals, including animal feed concentrates or feed supplements
•additives for animal feed preparation
•preparation of unmixed (single) feeds for farm animals
•treatment of slaughter waste to produce animal feeds

Description: MANUFACTURE OF BEVERAGES
MANUFACTURE OF BEVERAGES
Distilling, Rectifying and Blending of Spirits
Distilling, rectifying and blending of spirits; ethyl alcohol production from fermented materials (including samsu and Chinese liquors)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of distilled, potable, alcoholic beverages: whisky, brandy, gin, liqueurs, "mixed drinks", etc.
•blending of distilled spirits or production of neutral spirits

Description: Manufacture of Wines
Manufacture of wines
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•wine
•sparkling wine
•wine from concentrated grape must
•fermented but not distilled alcoholic beverages: sake, cider, perry, mead, other fruit wines or mixed beverages containing alcohol
•vermouth and the like
•low or non-alcoholic wine
•blending of wine

Description: Manufacture of Malt Liquors and Malt
Manufacture of malt liquors and malt (e.g. beer and stout)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•malt liquors, such as beer, ale, porter or stout
•malt
•low alcohol or non-alcoholic beer

Description: Manufacture of Soft Drinks, Production of Mineral Waters and Other Bottled Waters
Manufacture of soft drinks, production of mineral waters (including carbonated waters, soya bean milk, barley water, chrysanthemum water)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•non-alcoholic beverages, except non-alcoholic beer or wine
•soft drinks: non-alcoholic flavoured or sweetened waters: lemonade, orangeade, cola, fruit drinks, tonic waters, etc.
•artifically carbonated waters, soya bean milk, barley water, chrysanthemum water, etc.
•natural mineral waters or other bottled waters

Description: Manufacture of cordials, syrups and composite concentrates for beverages
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of of cordials, syrups or composite concentrates for beverages.

Description: Manufacture of ice except dry ice
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of ice except dry ice.

Description: MANUFACTURE OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS
MANUFACTURE OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS
Manufacture of Tobacco Products
Manufacture of cigarettes
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of cigarettes.

Description: Manufacture of tobacco products n.e.c. (e.g. cigars, loose tobacco)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of tobacco products not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•"homogenised" or "reconstituted" tobacco manufacturing
•stemming and re-drying of tobacco
•chewing/loose tobacco manufacturing

Description: MANUFACTURE OF TEXTILES
SPINNING, WEAVING AND FINISHING OF TEXTILES
Spinning, Weaving and Finishing of Textiles
Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•preparatory operations on textile fibres:
- reeling or washing of silk
- degreasing or carbonising of wool and dyeing of wool fleece
- carding or combing of all kinds of animal, vegetable or man-made fibres
- spinning or manufacture of yarn or thread for weaving or sewing, for the trade or for further processing: texturising, twisting, folding, cabling or dipping of synthetic or artificial filament yarns
•manufacture of:
- broad woven cotton-type, woollen-type, worsted-type or silk-type fabrics, including from mixtures or artificial or synthetic yarns
- other broad woven fabrics, using flax, ramie, hemp, jute, bast fibres or special yarns
- paper yarn
- woven pile or chenille fabrics, terry towelling, gauze, etc.
- woven fabrics of glass fibres
- woven fabrics of carbon or aramid threads
- imitation fur by weaving
•bleaching or dyeing of textile fibres, yarns, fabrics or textile articles, including wearing apparel
•dressing, drying, steaming, shrinking, mending, sanforising, mercerising of textiles and textile articles, including wearing apparel
•bleaching of jeans
•pleating or similar work on textiles
•waterproofing, coating, rubberising or impregnating of garments
•silk-screen printing on textiles or wearing apparel

Description: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER TEXTILES
Manufacture of Knitted and Crocheted Fabrics
Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics and laces
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics and laces, for instance:
- pile or terry fabrics
- net or window furnishing type fabrics knitted on Raschel or similar machines
- imitation fur by knitting
- other knitted or crocheted fabrics

Description: Manufacture of Made-Up Textile Articles except Apparel
Manufacture of curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets and bed spreads
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets or bed spreads.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•blankets, including travelling rugs
•bed linen
•curtains, bedspreads

Description: Manufacture of other made-up house furnishings (e.g. napkins, table cloths)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of other made-up house furnishings (e.g. napkins, table cloths).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•table, toilet or kitchen linen
•quilts, eiderdowns
•valances, blinds, furniture or machine covers, etc.
•dust cloths, dish cloths or similar articles

Description: Manufacture of made-up textile articles except apparel n.e.c. (e.g. scrolls, flags and sails, banners, canvas products, cushions, pillows)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of made-up textile articles (except apparel) not elsewhere classified.

Description: MANUFACTURE OF BASIC METALS
MANUFACTURE OF BASIC IRON AND STEEL
Manufacture of Basic Iron and Steel
Iron and steel rolling mills
Definition:
This Sub-class includes one of the following operations: 
•reduction of iron ore in blast furnaces and oxygen converters
•reduction of ferrous waste and scrap in electric arc furnaces 
•by direct reduction of iron ore without fusion to obtain crude steel. The crude steel is smelted and refined in a ladle furnace, and then poured and solidified in a continuous caster in order to produce semi-finished flat or long products. 

These products are used, after reheating, in rolling, drawing and extruding operations to manufacture finished products such as plate, sheet, strip, bars, rods, wire, tubes, pipes and hollow profiles.

Units in this Sub-class includes the manufacture of:
•hot-rolled or cold-rolled flat-rolled products of steel
•hot-rolled bars or rods of steel
•hot-rolled open sections of steel
•steel bars or solid sections of steel by cold drawing, grinding or turning
•open sections by progressive cold forming on a roll mill or folding on a press of flat-rolled products of steel
•wire of steel by cold drawing or stretching
•sheet piling of steel or welded open sections of steel
•railway track materials (unassembled rails) of steel
•seamless tubes, pipes or hollow profiles of steel, by hot rolling, hot extrusion or hot drawing, or by cold drawing or cold rolling
•welded tubes or pipes of steel, by cold or hot forming or welding, delivered as welded or further processed by cold drawing or cold rolling or manufactured by hot forming, welding and reducing
•tube fittings of steel, such as: flat flanges or flanges with forged collars, butt-welded fittings, threaded fittings, socket-welded fittings
•operation of blast furnaces, steel converters, rolling or finishing mills
•re-melting of scrap ingots of iron or steel
•pig iron or spiegeleisen in pigs, blocks or other primary forms

•distilling or rectifying plant for petroleum refineries, chemical industries, beverage industries, etc

Description: Manufacture and repair of solar modules and panels
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture, repair or maintenance of:
•solar modules
•solar panels

Description: Manufacture and repair of welding and soldering equipment (including arc welding electrodes)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture, repair or maintenance of:
•welding or soldering equipment 
•non-electrical welding or soldering equipment
•coated or cored welding wire; 
•soldering equipment (except handheld)
•ultrasonic welding equipment
•laser welding equipment

Description: Manufacture and repair of packaging machinery
Definition: This Sub-class includes manufacture, repair or maintenance of packing or wrapping machinery: filling, closing, sealing, capsuling or labelling machines, etc.

Description: Manufacture and repair of other general purpose machinery and equipment except electrical and electronic n.e.c.
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture, repair or maintenance of other general purpose machinery not elsewhere classified, for instance:
•weighing machinery (other than sensitive laboratory balances): household or shop scales, platform scales, scales for continuous weighing, weighbridges, weights, etc.
•equipment for projecting, dispersing or spraying liquids or powders: spray guns, fire extinguishers, sandblasting machines, steam cleaning machines, etc.
•calendering or other rolling machines or cylinders thereof (except for metal or glass)
•centrifuges (except cream separators or clothes dryers)
•gaskets or similar joints made of a combination of materials or layers of the same material
•automatic goods vending machines
•parts for general-purpose machinery
•levels, tape measures or similar hand tools, machinists' precision tools (except optical)

Description: MANUFACTURE OF SPECIAL PURPOSE MACHINERY
Manufacture and Repair of Agricultural and Forestry Machinery
Manufacture and repair of agricultural and forestry machinery
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair and maintenance of: 
•tractors used in agriculture and forestry
•walking (pedestrian-controlled) tractors
•mowers, including lawnmowers
•agricultural self-loading or self-unloading trailers or semi-trailers
•agricultural machinery for soil preparation, planting or fertilising (e.g. ploughs, manure spreaders, seeders, harrows)
•harvesting or threshing machinery (e.g. harvesters, threshers, sorters)
•milking machines
•spraying machinery for agricultural use
•diverse agricultural machinery (e.g. poultry-keeping machinery, bee-keeping machinery, equipment for preparing fodder; machines for cleaning, sorting or grading eggs, fruit)

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Metal-Forming Machinery and Machine Tools
Manufacture and repair of machinery and machine-tools - metal cutting types (e.g. lathes, milling machines, shaping machines)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of metal cutting machinery or machine tools.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•manufacture of machine tools for turning, drilling, milling, shaping, planing, boring, grinding, etc.

Description: Manufacture and repair of machinery and machine-tools - metal forming types (e.g. forging press, cold heading machines, press breaks)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of metal forming machinery or machine tools. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•manufacture of machine tools for working metals, including those using a laser beam, ultrasonic waves, plasma arc, magnetic pulse, etc.
•manufacture of stamping or pressing machine tools
•manufacture of punch presses, hydraulic presses, hydraulic brakes, drop hammers, forging machines, etc.
•manufacture of draw-benches, thread rollers or machines for working wires

Description: Manufacture of dies, moulds, tools, jigs and fixtures
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of special tools or fixtures, such as cutting dies or jigs. Units in this Sub-class are also known as tool or die shops.

Description: Manufacture of machine tool accessories (e.g. small cutting tools, precision measuring tools and other attachments such as tool holders)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of machine tool accessories or attachments for metal cutting or metal forming machine tools, for instance:
•knives or bits for metalworking lathes, planers, or shapers manufacturing
•measuring attachments (e.g., sine bars) for machine tool manufacturing
•metalworking drill bits manufacturing

Description: Manufacture and repair of metal additive manufacturing (AM) equipment (including metal powder)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of metal additive manufacturing (AM) equipment, metal powder additive manufacturing (AM) equipment, three-dimensional (3D) printer (metal-forming) manufacturing equipment.

Description: Manufacture and repair of metal-forming machinery and machine tools n.e.c. (including metalworking machinery)
Definition: This Sub-class includes includes the manufacture or repair of metal-forming machinery or machine tools that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•machinery for metallurgy manufacturing
•machinery for metallurgy repair and maintenance

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Machinery for Mining, Quarrying and Construction
Manufacture and repair of oil rigs
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of oil rigs.

Description: Manufacture and repair of other oilfield and gasfield machinery and equipment (e.g. derricks, tool joints)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes includes the manufacture or repair of other oilfield or gasfield machinery or equipment, such as:
•oilfield or gasfield derricks or tool joints
•continuous-action elevators or conveyors for underground use in oilfield or gasfield
•boring, cutting, sinking or tunnelling machinery (whether or not for underground use) in oilfield or gasfield
•machinery for treating minerals by screening, sorting, separating, washing, crushing, etc. in oilfield or gasfield
•earth-moving machinery (e.g. bulldozers, angle-dozers, graders, scrapers, levellers, mechanical shovels, shovel loaders) in oilfield or gasfield
•track-laying tractors or tractors used in oilfield or gasfield

Description: Manufacture and repair of construction machinery and parts
Definition:
This Sub-class includes includes the manufacture or repair of machinery or parts for construction use, for instance:
•continuous-action elevators or conveyors for underground use in construction
•boring, cutting, sinking or tunnelling machinery (whether or not for underground use) for use in construction
•machinery for treating minerals by screening, sorting, separating, washing, crushing, etc. for use in construction
•concrete or mortar mixers for use in construction
•earth-moving machinery (e.g. bulldozers, angle-dozers, graders, scrapers, levellers, mechanical shovels, shovel loaders) for use in construction
•pile drivers or pile extractors, mortar spreaders, bitumen spreaders, concrete surfacing machinery etc for use in construction
•track-laying tractors or tractors used in construction
•bulldozer or angle-dozer blades for use in construction
•off-road dumping trucks for use in construction

Description: Manufacture and repair of machinery for mining, quarrying and construction n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of other machinery for mining, quarrying or construction not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•boring machine manufacturing, except oilfield, gasfield and construction
•boring machine, repair and maintenance, except oilfield, gasfield and construction
•drilling and boring machine, manufacturing, except oilfield, gasfield and construction,

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Machinery for Food, Beverage and Tobacco Processing
Manufacture and repair of machinery for food products processing
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of machinery for food products processing, for instance: 
•agricultural dryers
•cheese-making machines (e.g. homogenisers, moulders, presses)
•machinery for the grain milling industry e.g. machinery to clean, sort or grade seeds, grain or dried leguminous vegetables (winnowers, sieving belts, separators, grain brushing machines, etc.)
•machinery to produce flour or meal etc (grinding mills, feeders, sifters, bran cleaners, blenders, rice hullers, pea splitters)
•machinery for the bakery industry or for making macaroni, spaghetti or similar products (e.g. bakery ovens, dough mixers, dough-dividers, moulders, slicers, cake depositing machines)
•machines or equipment to process diverse foods e.g. machinery to make confectionery, cocoa or chocolate; to manufacture sugar; to process meat or poultry; to prepare fruit, nuts or vegetables; to prepare fish, shellfish or other seafood, machinery for filtering or purifying, other machinery for the industrial preparation or manufacture of food
•machinery for the extraction or preparation of animal or vegetable fats or oils
•machinery for the preparation of food in hotels or restaurants

Description: Manufacture and repair of machinery for beverage production
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of machinery for beverage products processing, for instance: 
•machinery for the dairy industry e.g. cream separators
•milk processing machinery (e.g. homogenisers)
•milk converting machinery (e.g. butter chums, butter workers or moulding machines)
•presses, crushers etc used to make wine, cider, fruit juices, etc.
•machines or equipment to process diverse foods e.g. machinery for breweries
•other machinery for the industrial preparation or manufacture of drink
•machinery for the preparation of drinks in hotels or restaurants

Description: Manufacture and repair of machinery for tobacco processing
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of machinery for the preparation of tobacco or for the making of cigarettes or cigars, or for pipe or chewing tobacco or snuff.

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Machinery for Textile, Apparel and Leather Production
Manufacture and repair of machinery for textile, apparel and leather production
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of:
•textile machinery e.g. machines for preparing, producing, extruding, drawing, texturing or cutting man-made textile fibres, materials or yarns, machines for preparing textile fibres: cotton gins, bale breakers, garnetters, cotton spreaders, wool scourers, wool carbonisers, combs, carders, roving frames etc, spinning machines, machines for preparing textile yarns: reelers, warpers or related machines, weaving machines (looms), including hand looms, knitting machines, machines for making knotted net, tulle, lace, braid, etc. auxiliary machines or equipment for textile machinery (e.g. dobbies, jacquards, automatic stop motions, shuttle changing mechanisms, spindles or spindle flyers)
•textile printing machinery
•machinery for fabric processing (e.g. machinery for washing, bleaching, dyeing, dressing, finishing, coating or impregnating textile fabrics)
•machines for reeling, unreeling, folding, cutting or pinking textile fabrics
•laundry machinery (e.g. ironing machines, including fusing presses, commercial washing or drying machines, dry-cleaning machines)
•sewing machines, sewing machine heads or sewing machine needles (whether or not for household use)
•machines for producing or finishing felt or non-wovens
•leather machines (e.g. machinery for preparing, tanning or working hides, skins or leather, machinery for making or repairing footwear or other articles of hides, skins, leather or fur skins)

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Semiconductor Related Equipment
Manufacture of probe cards
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of probe cards.

Description: Manufacture of bonding tools
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of semiconductor bonding tools.

Description: Manufacture and repair of semiconductor assembly and testing equipment (including computer burn-in system)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of semiconductor assembly or packaging machinery.

Description: Manufacture and repair of semiconductor foundry equipment
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of:
•semiconductor foundry equipment
•semiconductor wafer processing equipment
•semiconductor etching equipment

Description: Manufacture and Repair of Other Special Purpose Machinery
Manufacture and repair of water/waste water treatment equipment
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture, repair or maintenance of water/waste water treatment equipment or components.

Description: Manufacture and repair of plastic processing machinery
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of plastics processing machinery. This includes machines for making a specific plastic product.

Description: Manufacture and repair of woodworking machinery
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of sawmill or woodworking machinery, such as circular or band sawing equipment, planing machinery, or sanding machinery.

Description: Manufacture and repair of polymer additive manufacturing (AM) equipment
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of polymer additive manufacturing (AM) equipment such as three-dimensional (3D) printer (plastic-forming) manufacturing.

Description: Manufacture and repair of other special purpose machinery n.e.c. (including plating equipment, industrial paint mixers and chemical mixing equipment)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture or repair of other special-purpose machinery that are not elsewhere classified, for instance:
•machinery for making paper pulp
•paper or paperboard making machinery
•dryers for wood, paper pulp, paper or paperboard
•machinery producing articles of paper or paperboard
•industrial mixing equipment for chemicals or paints
•machinery for working soft rubber or for the manufacture of products of soft rubber (e.g. extruders, moulders, pneumatic tyre making or retreading machines or other machines for making a specific rubber product)
•printing or bookbinding machines or machines for activities supporting printing on a variety of materials 
•machinery for producing tiles, bricks, shaped ceramic pastes, pipes, graphite electrodes, blackboard chalk, foundry moulds, etc.
•diverse special-purpose machinery or equipment (e.g. machines to assemble electric or electronic lamps, tubes (valves) or bulbs, machines for production or hot-working of glass or glassware, glass fibre or yarn, machinery or apparatus for isotopic separation)
•tyre alignment or balancing equipment; balancing equipment (except wheel balancing)
•central greasing systems
•aircraft launching gear, aircraft carrier catapults or related equipment
•automatic bowling alley equipment (e.g. pin-setters)
•roundabouts, swings, shooting galleries or other fairground amusements

Description: INSTALLATION OF INDUSTRIAL MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT
Installation of Industrial Machinery and Equipment
Installation of industrial machinery and equipment, mechanical engineering works
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the specialised installation of machinery. However, the installation of equipment that forms an integral part of buildings or similar structures, such as installation of escalators, electrical wiring, burglar alarm systems or air-conditioning systems, is classified as construction.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•installation of industrial machinery in industrial plant
•installation of industrial process control equipment
•installation of other industrial equipment (e.g. communications equipment, mainframe or similar computers, irradiation or electromedical equipment, etc.)
•dismantling large-scale machinery or equipment
•activities of millwrights
•machine rigging 
•installation of bowling alley equipment 
•mechanical engineering works

Description: MANUFACTURE OF MOTOR VEHICLES, TRAILERS AND SEMI-TRAILERS
MANUFACTURE OF MOTOR VEHICLES, TRAILERS AND SEMI-TRAILERS
Manufacture of Motor Vehicles
Manufacture and assembly of motor vehicles
Definition:
This Sub-class includes 
•manufacture of:
- passenger cars
- commercial vehicles (e.g. vans, lorries, over-the-road tractors for semi-trailers )
- buses, trolley-buses or coaches
- motor vehicle engines
- chassis fitted with engines
- other motor vehicles (e.g. snowmobiles, golf carts, amphibious vehicles, fire engines, street sweepers, travelling libraries, armoured cars, concrete-mixer lorries, ATVs, go-carts or similar including race cars)
•factory rebuilding of motor vehicle engines
•factory retrofitting of engine onto motor vehicle

Description: MANUFACTURE OF MOTOR VEHICLE BODIES (COACHWORK), TRAILERS AND SEMI-TRAILERS
Manufacture of Motor Vehicle Bodies (Coachwork), Trailers and Semi-Trailers
Manufacture of motor vehicle bodies (coachwork), trailers and semi-trailers
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture of:
•bodies, including cabs for motor vehicles
•trailers or semi-trailers (e.g. for transport of goods: tankers, removal trailers; for transport of passengers: caravan trailers)
•containers for carriage by one or more modes of transport
•outfitting of all types of motor vehicles, trailers or semi-trailers

Description: MANUFACTURE OF PARTS AND ACCESSORIES FOR MOTOR VEHICLES
Manufacture of Parts and Accessories for Motor Vehicles
Manufacture of parts and accessories for motor vehicles (e.g. engine parts, brakes, clutches, axles, gear boxes)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture of diverse parts or accessories for motor vehicles (e.g. brakes, gearboxes, axles, road wheels, suspension shock absorbers, radiators, silencers, exhaust pipes, catalytic converters, clutches, steering wheels, steering columns or steering boxes)
•manufacture of parts or accessories of bodies for motor vehicles (e.g. safety belts, airbags, doors, bumpers)
•manufacture of car seats
•manufacture of motor vehicle electrical equipment, such as generators, alternators, spark plugs, ignition wiring harnesses, power window or door systems
•assembly of purchased gauges into instrument panels, voltage regulators, etc.

Description: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT
BUILDING AND REPAIRING OF SHIPS AND BOATS
Building and Repairing of Ships and Floating Structures
Building and repairing of ships, tankers and other ocean-going vessels (including conversion of ships into off-shore structures)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the building or repairing of ships, except vessels for sports or recreation, or the construction of floating structures such as floating cranes or drilling platforms.

This Sub-class also includes 
•manufacture of sections for ships or floating structures
•building or repairing of:
- commercial vessels:  passenger vessels, ferry boats, cargo ships, tankers, tugs, etc.
- warships
- fishing boats or fish-processing factory vessels
- hovercraft (except recreation-type hovercraft)
- ship parts 
•construction of:
- drilling platforms, floating or submersible
- floating structures (e.g. floating docks, pontoons, coffer-dams, floating landing stages, buoys, floating tanks, barges, floating cranes, non-recreational inflatable rafts)

Description: Building of Pleasure Boats and Sporting Boats
Building and repair of pleasure crafts, lighters and boats
Definition:
This Sub-class includes
•building and repairing of:
- sailboats with or without auxiliary motor
- motor boats
- recreation-type hovercraft
•manufacture of:
- inflatable boats and rafts
- personal watercraft
- other pleasure and sporting boats (e.g. canoes, kayaks, rowing boats, skiffs)

Description: MANUFACTURE OF RAILWAY LOCOMOTIVES AND ROLLING STOCK
Manufacture of Railway Locomotives and Rolling Stock
Manufacture and repair of railway and tramway locomotives and rolling stock (including specialised parts except engines, electric motors and signalling equipment)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture or repair of:
•electric, diesel, steam or other rail locomotives
•self-propelled railway or tramway coaches, vans or trucks, maintenance or service vehicles
•railway or tramway rolling stock, not self-propelled (e.g. passenger coaches, goods vans, tank wagons, self-discharging vans or wagons, workshop vans, crane vans, tenders)
•specialised parts of railway or tramway locomotives or of rolling stock (e.g. bogies, axles or wheels, brakes or parts of brakes; hooks or coupling devices, buffers or buffer parts; shock absorbers; wagon or locomotive frames; bodies; corridor connections)
•mechanical or electromechanical signalling, safety or traffic control equipment for railways, tramways, inland waterways, roads, parking facilities, airfields, etc.
•mining locomotives or mining rail cars
•railway car seats

Description: MANUFACTURE OF AIR AND SPACECRAFT AND RELATED MACHINERY
Manufacture of Air and Spacecraft and Related Machinery
Manufacture and assembly of aircraft and spacecraft (including aircraft engines and other parts)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•manufacture or assembly of:
- airplanes for the transport of goods or passengers, for use by the defence forces, for sport or other purposes
- helicopters
- gliders, hang-gliders
- dirigibles or hot air balloons
- parts or accessories of the aircraft of this Sub-class:  major assemblies such as fuselages, wings, doors, control surfaces, landing gear, fuel tanks, nacelles, etc.; airscrews, helicopter rotors or propelled rotor blades; motors or engines of a kind typically found on aircraft; parts of turbojets or turboprops for aircraft
- ground flying trainers
- aircraft seats
- aircraft engines
•overhaul or conversion of aircraft or aircraft engines

Description: Repair and servicing of aircraft and spacecraft (including aircraft engines and other parts)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the repair and maintenance of aircraft and spacecraft including that of:
•helicopters
•aircraft engines of all types 
•air cushion vehicles
•aero-space equipment
•aero-engine parts

Description: MANUFACTURE OF MILITARY FIGHTING VEHICLES
Manufacture of Military Fighting Vehicles
Manufacture of military fighting vehicles
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture or repair of:
•military tanks
•armoured amphibious military vehicles or parts
•other military fighting vehicles containers for carriage by one or more modes of transport

Description: MANUFACTURE OF OTHER TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT N.E.C.
Manufacture of Motorcycles
Manufacture and assembly of motorcycles and scooters (including engines and other parts and accessories)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture of:
•motorcycles, mopeds or cycles fitted with an auxiliary engine
•engines for motorcycles
•sidecars
•parts or accessories for motorcycles

Description: Manufacture of Bicycles and Invalid Carriages
Manufacture and assembly of bicycles, tricycles, trishaws and invalid carriages (including parts and accessories)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture of:
•non-motorised bicycles or other cycles, including (delivery) tricycles, tandems, children's bicycles or tricycles
•parts or accessories of bicycles
•invalid carriages with or without motor
•parts or accessories of invalid carriages
•baby carriages

Description: Manufacture of Other Transport Equipment n.e.c.
Manufacture of other transport equipment n.e.c. (e.g. carts, wagons)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes manufacture or repair of:
•hand-propelled vehicles (e.g. luggage trucks, handcarts, sledges, shopping carts)
•vehicles drawn by animals (e.g. sulkies, donkey-carts, hearses)

MANUFACTURE OF FURNITURE

Manufacture of furniture and fixtures of wood (including upholstery)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of furniture or fixtures of wood (including finishing such as upholstery of chairs or seats), for any place or various purposes.

Description: Manufacture of mattresses including those of foam rubber

Description: OTHER MANUFACTURING
MANUFACTURE OF JEWELLERY, BIJOUTERIE AND RELATED ARTICLES
Manufacture of Jewellery and Related Articles
Manufacture of jewellery except costume jewellery
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of jewellery except costume jewellery.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in:
•production of:
- worked pearls
- precious or semi-precious stones in the worked state, including the working of industrial quality stones or synthetic or reconstructed precious or semi-precious stones
•working of diamonds
•manufacture of:
- jewellery of precious metal or of base metals clad with precious metals, or precious or semi-precious stones, or of combinations of precious metal or precious or semi-precious stones or of other materials

Description: Manufacture of pewter ware
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of pewter ware.

Description: Manufacture of jewellery and related articles n.e.c. (except costume jewellery)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the manufacture of jewellery or related articles not elswhere classified.
Examples:
•precious metal watch bands, wristbands, watch straps or cigarette cases manufacturing
•coins, including coins for use as legal tender, whether or not of precious metal manufacturing
•engraving of personal precious or non-precious metal products
•goldsmiths’ articles of precious metals or of base metals clad with precious metals: dinnerware, flatware, hollowware, toilet articles, office or desk articles, articles for religious use, etc.
•technical or laboratory articles of precious metal (except instruments or parts thereof): crucibles, spatulas, electroplating anodes, etc.

Description: Manufacture of Costume Jewellery and Related Articles
Manufacture of costume jewellery and related articles
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of costume jewellery or related articles.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•costume or imitation jewellery:
- rings, bracelets, necklaces, or similar articles of jewellery made from base metals plated with precious metals
- jewellery containing imitation stones such as imitation gems stones, imitation diamonds, or similar
•metal watch bands (except precious metal)

Description: MANUFACTURE OF MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS
Manufacture of Musical Instruments
Manufacture of musical instruments
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of musical instruments.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•stringed instruments
•keyboard stringed instruments, including automatic pianos
•keyboard pipe organs, including harmoniums or similar keyboard instruments with free metal reeds
•accordions or similar instruments, including mouth organs
•wind instruments
•percussion musical instruments
•musical instruments, the sound of which is produced electronically
•musical boxes, fairground organs, calliopes, etc.
•instrument parts or accessories: metronomes, tuning forks, pitch pipes, cards, discs or rolls for automatic mechanical instruments, etc.
•whistles, call horns or other mouth-blown sound signalling instruments

Description: MANUFACTURE OF SPORTS GOODS
Manufacture of Sports Goods
Manufacture of sporting and athletic goods (including gym, diving and underwater equipment)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of sporting or athletic goods including gym, diving or underwater equipment.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of articles or equipment for sports, outdoor or indoor games, of any material:
•hard, soft or inflatable balls
•rackets, bats or clubs
•skis, bindings or poles
•ski-boots
•sailboards or surfboards
•requisites for sport fishing, including landing nets
•requisites for hunting, mountain climbing, etc.
•leather sports gloves or sports headgear
•ice skates, roller skates, etc.
•bows or crossbows
•gymnasium, fitness centre or athletic equipment

Description: MANUFACTURE OF GAMES AND TOYS
Manufacture of Games and Toys
Manufacture of games and toys
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the manufacture of dolls, toys or games (including electronic games), scale models or children's vehicles (except metal bicycles or tricycles).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in the manufacture of:
•dolls or doll garments, parts or accessories
•action figures
•toy animals
•toy musical instruments
•playing cards
•board games or similar games
•electronic games: chess, etc.
•reduced-size ("scale") models or similar recreational models, electrical trains, construction sets, etc.
•coin-operated games, billiards, special tables for casino games, etc.
•wheeled toys designed to be ridden, including plastic bicycles or tricycles
•puzzles or similar articles

Description: ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR-CONDITIONING SUPPLY
ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR-CONDITIONING SUPPLY
ELECTRIC POWER GENERATION, TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION
Electric Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution
Generation of electricity by fossil fuels
Definition: This Sub-class includes the generation of electricity by fossil fuels such as coal, oil and natural gas. This economic activity may require a licence from the Energy Market Authority or its equivalent.

Description: Generation of electricity by other sources (e.g. solar power, biofuels etc)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the generation of electricity by non-fossil fuel sources (e.g. solar power, biofuels). This economic activity may require a licence from the Energy Market Authority or its equivalent.

Description: Transmission, distribution and sale of electricity
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the transmission and sale of electricity to households, industrial and commercial users. This economic activity may require a licence from the Energy Market Authority or its equivalent.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•operation of transmission systems that convey the electricity from the generation facility to the distribution system 
•operation of distribution systems (i.e. consisting of lines, poles, meters, and wiring) that convey electric power received from the generation facility or the transmission system to the final consumer 
•sale of electricity to the user, including through electric charging stations/kiosks

Description: Other related services (e.g. electricity brokers, meter reading)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of electric power brokers or agents that arrange the sale of electricity via power distribution systems operated by others and support services such as meter reading and meter data management.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•activities of electric power brokers or agents that arrange the sale of electricity via power distribution systems operated by others
•operation of electricity and transmission capacity exchanges for electric power
•reading of the register of any electricity meter and the management of data relating to meter reading
•provision of customer transfer services for electricity retailers and consumers

Description: WASTE COLLECTION, TREATMENT AND DISPOSAL ACTIVITIES; MATERIALS RECOVERY
WASTE COLLECTION
Collection of Waste
Collection of waste
Definition:
This Sub-class includes: 
•collection of non-hazardous solid waste (i.e. garbage) within a local area, such as collection of waste (including mixed recoverable materials) from households and businesses by various means (e.g. refuse bins, wheeled bins, containers) 
•collection of hazardous or toxic waste like:
- used oil from shipment or garages
- bio-hazardous waste
- used batteries
•collection of recyclable materials 
•collection of used cooking oils or fats
•collection of refuse in litter-bins in public places
•operation of waste transfer stations for hazardous or non-hazardous waste
•collection of construction and demolition waste
•collection and removal of debris

Description: WASTE TREATMENT AND DISPOSAL
Treatment and Disposal of Waste (including Remediation Activities)
Treatment and disposal of waste (including remediation activities)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the treatment prior to disposal and other treatment of hazardous and non-hazardous waste, the disposal of waste, and remediation activities. The waste may be in solid or non-solid form. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•operation of landfills for disposal of waste
•disposal of waste by combustion or incineration or other methods, with or without the resulting production of electricity or steam, substitute fuels, biogas, ashes or other by-products for further use, etc.
•treatment of organic waste for disposal
•disposal of used goods such as refrigerators to eliminate harmful waste
•remediation activities like:
- decontamination of soils and groundwater at the place of pollution, either in situ or ex situ
- decontamination and cleaning up of surface water following accidental pollution
- cleaning up of oil spills and other pollutions on land, in surface water, in ocean and seas, including coastal areas and other specialised pollution-control activities

Description: MATERIALS RECOVERY
Materials Recovery
Recycling of metal waste and scrap
Definition:
This Sub-class includes recycling of metal waste and scrap.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•processing of metal waste and scrap into secondary raw materials, or a form which is readily transformed into new raw materials. This usually requires a mechanical or chemical transformation process.
•separating and sorting of recoverable metal waste and scrap from garbage
•separating and sorting of commingled recoverable metal waste and scrap into distinct categories like used aluminium beverage cans and metals

Description: Recycling of non-metal waste n.e.c. (e.g. marine clay and oil sludge)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes recycling of non-metal waste.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•processing of non-metal waste into secondary raw materials, or a form which is readily transformed into new raw materials. This usually requires a mechanical or chemical transformation process. 
•separating and sorting of recoverable non-metal waste from garbage
•separating and sorting of commingled recoverable non-metal waste into distinct categories like paper and plastics
Examples:
•recycling of marine clay
•recycling of oil sludge
•recycling of plastic waste
