Definition: This Sub-class includes rental and leasing of freight land transport vehicle (e.g. lorries and trucks) with driver.

Description: TRANSPORT VIA PIPELINES
Transport via Pipelines
Transport via pipelines
Definition: This Sub-class includes the transport of gases, liquids, water, slurry and other commodities via pipelines and the operation of pump stations.

Description: WATER TRANSPORT
WATER TRANSPORT
Passenger Water Transport
International cruise services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of international cruise services to or from foreign ports.

Description: Other sight-seeing cruise services (e.g. harbour and river cruises)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of water transportation equipment for scenic and sightseeing activities as a form of recreation and entertainment. The service provided might include tour commentary that highlights features of the scenery.

Description: Passenger ferry services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of ferries and water taxis as a form of transportation.

Description: Chartering of ships and boats with crew (passenger)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•chartering of ships, boats or yachts with crew for:
- entertainment and recreation (e.g. fishing cruises)
- transportation of passengers
•shipping trusts which own or operate passenger ships with crew

Description: Freight Water Transport
Shipping companies, including chartering of ships and boats with crew (freight)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes
•transport of freight on ships or boats with crew designed for operating on sea or coastal waters
•shipping trusts that provide ship or boat chartering services with crew

Description: Operators and charterers of barges, tugboats and bumboats (freight)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•operators and charterers of barges, tugboats or bumboats with crew for the transport of freight via rivers, canals or other inland waterways, including inside harbours or ports
•shipping trusts that provide barges, tugboats or bumboats chartering services with crew

Description: Branches of foreign shipping lines
Definition: This Sub-class includes local branch offices of overseas ship operators or owners.

Description: AIR TRANSPORT
AIR TRANSPORT
Air Transport
Airlines (passenger)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of air transportation of passengers over regular routes and on regular schedules.

Description: Airlines (freight)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of air transportation of freight over regular routes and on regular schedules.

Description: Branches of foreign airlines (passenger)
Definition: This Sub-class includes local branch offices of overseas airlines (passenger).

Description: Branches of foreign airlines (freight)
Definition: This Sub-class includes local branch offices of overseas airlines (freight).

Description: Aircraft chartering with operator
Definition:
This Sub-class includes aircraft chartering with operator for:
•non-scheduled transport of freight by air
•launching of satellites and space vehicles
•space transport 
•passenger or freight transportation
•general aviation activities, such as transport of passengers by aero clubs for instruction or pleasure

Description: WAREHOUSING AND SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION
WAREHOUSING AND STORAGE
Warehousing and Storage
General warehousing
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of warehouse and storage facilities for general merchandise. Examples of goods stored are general merchandise, base metals or soft commodities (e.g. agricultural crops).

Description: Refrigerated warehousing and storage
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of refrigerated warehouse and storage facilities for goods like perishable food products. Units in this Sub-class provide services that include blast freezing, tempering, and modified atmosphere storage services.

Description: Storage for dangerous goods
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of storage facilities for dangerous goods (e.g. explosives, petroleum, oils, specialty chemicals, liquefied petroleum gas, flammable materials).

Description: Specialised storage n.e.c. (e.g. wine warehousing, document storage and warehousing)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of warehouse and storage facilities for all other types of goods and merchandise not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•document storage and warehousing
•wine warehousing

Description: SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION
Supporting Services to Land Transport
Carpark management and operation services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation and management of parking space for land transport vehicles.

Description: Motor vehicle towing services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of motor vehicle towing and road side assistance services.

Description: Supporting services to land transport n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of supporting services to the land transport industry not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•liquefaction of gas for transportation purposes
•operation and maintenance of terminal facilities like railway stations, bus stations, stations for the handling of goods
•switching and shunting

Description: Supporting Services to Water Transport
Representative offices of foreign shipping lines
Definition:
This Sub-class includes representative offices of foreign shipping lines. A representative office of a foreign shipping line is set up strictly to explore opportunities in the region. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•conduct research on demand for services
•cultivate trade contacts and handle enquiries
•collect information about markets, competitors or customers
•gather information on business regulatory requirement for subsequent set up of permanent entity
•participate in exhibitions and trade shows

Description: Shipping agencies (freight)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of shipping agencies, who act on behalf of ship owners, ship managers and charterers to ensure that their requirements are met at the port of docking.
 
Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•handling of shipments and cargo
•secure ship supplies
•arrange crew changes
•husbandry
•customs documentation

Description: Port operators
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the operation and maintenance of ports, harbours or cruise/ferry terminals (including docking and pier facilities)
•provision of terminal facilities such as harbours or piers
•operation of waterway locks
•pilotage or berthing activities

Description: Lighterage services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of lighterage services (i.e. transferring cargo by means of a lighter between vessels of different sizes, usually between a barge and a bulker or oil tanker).

Description: Salvaging of distressed vessels and cargos
Definition: This Sub-class includes cargo salvaging from distressed vessels.

Description: Ship management services
Definition:
This Sub-class include the provision of ship management service (i.e. operation of ships on behalf of owners).

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•crew recruitment or management
•management of the ships' commercial activity
•bunkering
•employment of ship agents
•registration of vessels
•technical management of vessels

Description: Ship brokering services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of ship brokering services (e.g. ship building brokers, ship chartering brokers, ship purchasing brokers, ship repairing brokers, ship selling brokers).

Description: Supporting services to water transport n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of other supporting services to water transport not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•navigation or management of vessel movements in the port
•ship mooring service
•lighthouse activities

Description: Supporting Services to Air Transport
Representative offices of foreign airlines
Definition:
This Sub-class includes representative offices of foreign shipping lines. A representative office of a foreign airline is set up strictly to explore opportunities in the region. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•conduct research on demand for services
•cultivate trade contacts and handle enquiries
•collect information about markets, competitors or customers
•gather information on business regulatory requirement for subsequent set up of permanent entity
•participate in exhibitions and trade shows

Description: Airline agencies (freight)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the activities of cargo sales agent for airlines.

Description: Airport operation services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the operation and management of airports.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•landing, parking or aerobridge fees or passenger service charges
•runway maintenance services
•fire-fighting or fire-prevention services at airports
•provision of other airport and airport-related facilities or services

Description: Airport terminal services (e.g. ground service activities)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of airport terminal services (e.g. ground service activities):
- baggage handling or air cargo handling services
- passenger check-in services
- ramp services
- aircraft towing

Description: Supporting services to air transport n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of other supporting services for air transportation that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•air traffic control services
•aircraft inspection services
•aircraft testing services

Description: Cargo Handling
Container depot services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of container depots or container yards (except port operator). Additional services like storage of the empty containers, inspection, modification, cleaning and repair of containers as well as inland trucking of empty containers to meet their customer’s container management requirements may also be provided.

Description: Crane services for all industries except construction
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of crane services with operator for all industries except construction.

Description: Stevedoring services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of stevedoring services (i.e. loading and unloading of freight on and off shore while they are in port).

Description: Marine Surveying Services and Classification Societies
Classification societies
Definition: This Sub-class includes classification societies that perform statutory certification and survey services for Singapore-flagged ships. This economic activity may require authorisation from the Marine Port Authority or its equivalent.

Description: Marine surveying services other than classification societies
Definition: This Sub-class includes marine surveying services (i.e. ship appraiser) other than classification societies.

Description: Other Transportation Support Activities
Cargo surveying services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of cargo surveying services (e.g. cargo inspection, sampling, weighing services).

Description: Freight transport arrangement
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the operation of value added logistics providers or freight forwarding agents.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•planning, designing and supporting operations of transportation, warehousing or distribution
•forwarding of freight by rail, road, sea or air
•arranging or organising of transport operations by rail, road, sea or air
•organisation of group and individual consignments (including pickup and delivery of goods and grouping of consignments)
•activities of sea-freight forwarders and air-cargo agents
•goods-handling operations, e.g. temporary crating for the sole purpose of protecting the goods during transit, uncrating, sampling or weighing of goods
•issue and procurement of transport documents or waybills
•activities of customs agents

Description: POSTAL AND COURIER ACTIVITIES
POSTAL ACTIVITIES
National Post Activities
National post activities (e.g. postal services)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of postal services operating involving the conveyance of letters or postal articles through the postal service infrastructure. This economic activity may require a Postal Services Operator’s licence that is issued by the Info-communications Media Development Authority or its equivalent.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•receiving, collecting, sorting, sending, despatching and delivering (domestic and international) of postal articles (i.e. letter-post and parcel-post) and any other related services 
- items delivered can include letters, postcards, printed papers (newspaper, periodicals, advertising items, etc.), small packets, goods or documents of up to 2kg only. 
- one or more modes of transport may be involved and the activity may be carried out with either self-owned (private) transport or via public transport
•collection of postal articles from the postal network, such as public letter-boxes or from post offices
•distribution and delivery of postal articles

Description: COURIER ACTIVITIES
Courier Activities Other than National Post Activities
Courier activities other than national post activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes courier activities involving the conveyance of express letters and parcel items, and general commercial items. Courier activities (other than national post activities) involves the conveyance of express letters or items through networks other than the postal service infrastructure, and typically involve value-added services such as door-to-door pick-up and delivery of items, item tracking and acknowledgement of receipt of the item. One or more modes of transport may be involved and the activity may be carried out with either self-owned (private) transport or via public transport.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•pickup, sorting, transport and delivery (domestic or international) of letters and parcels by firms not utilising the postal service infrastructure
•distribution and delivery of mail and parcels

Description: ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES
ACCOMMODATION
SHORT TERM ACCOMMODATION ACTIVITIES
Short Term Accommodation Activities
Hotels
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of furnished accommodation in hotels, typically on a daily or weekly basis, principally for short stay by visitors
•Examples of facilities or services provided:
- daily or other regular housekeeping services
- food and beverage services in restaurants on the premises
- laundry services
- swimming pools or exercise rooms
- conference or convention facilities
•provision of hotel management services (i.e. providing management and operating staff to run hotel)

Description: Chalets
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of accommodation, typically on a daily or weekly basis, principally for short stay by visitors, in self-contained space consisting of complete furnished rooms or areas for living/dining and sleeping, with cooking facilities or fully equipped kitchens. This may take the form of clusters of buildings or single storey bungalows and chalets. Very minimal complementary services, if any, are provided.
•provision of chalet management services (i.e. providing management and operating staff to run chalets).

Description: Short term accommodation activities other than hotels and chalets
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of furnished accommodation in facilities known as hostels or guesthouses, typically on a daily or weekly basis, principally for short stay by visitors. Daily or other regular housekeeping services might be provided
•provision of hostels or guesthouse accommodation management services (i.e. providing management and operating staff to run short term accommodation like hostels or guesthouses)

Description: HOSTELS AND DORMITORIES FOR STUDENTS, WORKERS AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS
Hostels and dormitories for students, workers and other individuals
Hostels and dormitories for students, workers and other individuals
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of temporary or longer-term accommodation in single or shared rooms or dormitories for students, workers and other individuals. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•student residences
•school dormitories
•worker hostels
•lodging and boarding houses

Description: FOOD AND BEVERAGE SERVICE ACTIVITIES
RESTAURANTS, CAFES, FOOD COURTS, FOOD KIOSKS AND BARS
Restaurants and Cafes
Restaurants
Definition: This Sub-class refers to full-service restaurants.

Description: Cafes
Definition: This Sub-class refers to fast-casual restaurants.

Description: Fast Food Outlets, Food Courts and Food Kiosks
Fast food outlets
Definition:
This Sub-class refers to:
•limited service restaurants that sell cooked fast food which is typically consumed as a meal or part of a meal and can be prepared and served quickly upon order
- the food sold is usually designed to be eaten on the go and mostly does not require the use of cutlery to be consumed
- the food may be for immediate consumption, take out or delivery.
- customers mostly serve themselves using a tray over a counter and are required to pay before receiving the food

Description: Food courts, coffee shops and canteens (with mainly food and beverage income)
Definition: This Sub-class includes food courts, coffee shops and canteens in which there are mix of stalls selling a variety of cooked food.

Description: Food kiosks mainly for takeaway and delivery
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of food mainly for takeaways or delivery. There is typically limited or no seating at such establishments.

Description: Pubs
Pubs
Definition: This Sub-class includes pubs and cocktail lounges that prepare and serve mainly alcoholic beverages for immediate consumption on the premises.

Description: Stalls Selling Cooked Food and Prepared Drinks
Stalls selling cooked food and prepared drinks (including stalls at food courts and mobile food hawkers)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes activities of hawkers and stall-holders selling cooked food and prepared drinks from stalls at food courts, coffee shops and canteens or mobile vehicles for immediate consumption.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•activities of:
- hawkers and stall-holders selling cooked food
- hawkers and stall-holders selling prepared drinks
- mobile food hawkers (e.g. mobile ice cream vendor, night market stall holder)
- pushcarts selling cooked food or prepared drinks

Description: FOOD CATERERS
Food Caterers
Food caterers
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of food services based on contractual arrangements with the customer, at the location specified by the customer, for a specific event or for a specific period of time based on a menu specified by the customer. The food is often prepared in a central unit.

Meals and snacks may be transported or prepared and served on or off the premises, as required by the customer.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
- event catering
- transportation catering (e.g. airline catering)
- home meal catering for a specific period of time

Description: INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS
PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES
PUBLISHING OF BOOKS, PERIODICALS AND OTHER PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES
Book Publishing
Publishing of books, brochures, musical books and other publications
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the publishing of the following: 
•books, brochures, leaflets
•dictionaries, encyclopedias, textbooks and educational materials
•atlases, maps and charts 
•music and sheet books

Units in this Sub-class make copyrighted content available to the general public by engaging in the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms (e.g. print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet).

Description: Publishing of Directories and Mailing Lists
Publishing of directories and mailing lists (including financial databases)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the publishing of lists of facts/information (databases) that are protected in their form, but not in their content.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged one or more of the following:
•publishing of mailing lists
•publishing of telephone books
•publishing of statistics databases
•publishing of financial databases
•publishing of other directories and compilations, such as case law, pharmaceutical compendia, etc.

Units in this Sub-class make copyrighted content available to the general public by engaging in the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms (e.g. print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet).

Description: Publishing of News, Journals and Periodicals
Publishing of news
Definition: This Sub-class includes publishing of news and newspapers. Units in this Sub-class make copyrighted content available to the general public by engaging in the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms (e.g. print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet).

Description: Publishing of journals, periodicals and magazines
Definition: This Sub-class includes publishing of journals, periodicals and magazines. Units in this Sub-class make copyrighted content available to the general public by engaging in the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms (e.g. print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet).

Description: Other Publishing Activities
Other publishing activities (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes publishing activities not elsewhere classified. Units in this Sub-class make copyrighted content available to the general public by engaging in the reproduction and distribution of this content in various forms (e.g. print, electronic or audio form, on the Internet).
Examples:
•publishing of posters
•publishing of advertising material
•publishing of content (e.g. photographs, articles) uploaded via social networking sites/platforms

Description: SOFTWARE PUBLISHING
Software Publishing
Publishing of games software/applications
Definition: This Sub-class includes publishing of ready-made (non-customised) games software and applications for all platforms.

Description: Publishing of software/applications (non-games)
Definition: This Sub-class includes publishing of ready-made (non-customised) software and applications (non-games) for all platforms.

Description: MOVIE, VIDEO, TELEVISION AND OTHER PROGRAMME PRODUCTION, SOUND RECORDING AND MUSIC PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES
MOVIE, VIDEO, TELEVISION AND OTHER PROGRAMME PRODUCTION ACTIVITIES
Movie, Video, Television and Other Programme Production Activities
Movie production
Definition: This Sub-class includes production of theatrical and non-theatrical movies on various modes (e.g. film, disc or online) for direct projection in theatres or for broadcasting on various mediums (e.g. television, tablets, computers, mobile devices).

Description: Production of advertisements, corporate videos and event videos
Definition: This Sub-class includes production of advertisements, corporate videos or event videos on various modes (e.g. film, disc, online) for broadcasting on various mediums (e.g. television, tablets, computers, theatres, mobile devices).

Description: Production of dramas, variety shows and documentaries (including production of television programme)
Definition: This Sub-class includes production of television programmes such as dramas, variety shows and documentaries for broadcasting on various mediums (e.g. television, tablets, computers, mobile devices).

Description: Animation production
Definition: This Sub-class includes production of animation on various modes (e.g. film, disc, online) for direct projection in theatres or for broadcasting on various mediums (e.g. television, tablets, computers, mobile devices).

Description: Movie, video, television and other programme production activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes other programme production activities not elsewhere classified.

Description: Movie, Video, Television and Other Programme Post-Production Activities
Movie, video, television and other programme post-production activities (including remastering)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes programme post-production activities such as:
•editing, cutting, dubbing
•titling, subtitling, credits
•closed captioning
•computer-produced graphics, animation and special effects
•film/tape transfers
•activities of motion picture film laboratories
•developing and processing motion picture film
•reproduction of motion picture film for theatrical distribution
•activities of stock footage film libraries.

Description: Movie, Video, Television and Other Programme Distribution Activities
Movie distribution
Definition: This Sub-class includes distribution of movies through various forms (e.g. film, disc, electronic) to movie theatres, television networks and stations and exhibitors. Buying and selling of movies or any other film production distribution rights is also included.

Description: Distribution of television programmes (e.g. dramas, variety shows and documentaries)
Definition: This Sub-class includes distribution of television programmes like dramas, variety shows and documentaries through various forms (e.g. film, disc, electronic) to television networks and stations and exhibitors. Buying and selling of the distribution rights for such programmes is also included.

Description: Movie, video, television and other programme distribution activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes movie, video, television and other programme distribution activities not elsewhere classified.

Description: Movie Projection Activities
Movie projection activities (including cinemas)
Definition: This Sub-class includes projection of movies and other film productions (e.g. video tapes, DVDs) in the open air or other projection facilities (e.g. cinemas) and other services allied to movie, video and television. Also included are activities of cine-clubs.

Description: SOUND RECORDING AND MUSIC PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES
Sound Recording and Music Publishing Activities
Sound recording production
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of facilities and technical expertise for sound recording in a studio. Audio production and post-production services are provided to produce master recordings and the audio services provided can be for film, television and video productions.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in:
•production of original (sound) master recordings, such as tapes, CDs
•sound recording service activities in a studio or elsewhere, including the production of taped (i.e. non-live) radio programming, audio for film, television, etc.

Description: Music publishing and distribution activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes music publishing activities in various forms (e.g. disc, electronic form). Units engaged in these activities may own the copyright or act as administrator of the music copyrights on behalf of the copyright owners.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following activities:
•acquiring and registering copyrights for musical compositions
•promoting, authorising and using these compositions in recordings, radio, television, movies, live performances, print and other media
•distributing sound recordings to wholesalers, retailers or directly to the public

Description: RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTING ACTIVITIES
RADIO PROGRAMME PRODUCTION AND BROADCASTING
Radio Programme Production and Broadcasting
Radio programme production and broadcasting
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of creating radio content on entertainment, news, talk, and the like or acquiring the right to distribute these content and subsequently broadcasting these content. Also included is data broadcasting, typically integrated with radio broadcasting. The broadcasting can be performed using different technologies, over-the-air, via satellite, via a cable network or via Internet. The production of radio programmes that are typically narrowcast in nature (limited format, such as news, sports, education or youth-oriented programming) on a subscription or fee basis, to a third party, for subsequent broadcasting to the public is also included. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•broadcasting audio signals through radio broadcasting studios and facilities for the transmission of aural programming to the public, to affiliates or to subscribers. The aural programmes may originate in their own radio studios, from an affiliated network or from external sources
•activities of radio networks, i.e. assembling and transmitting aural programming to the affiliates or subscribers via over-the-air broadcasts, cable or satellite
•broadcasting activities over the Internet (Internet radio stations)
•data broadcasting integrated with radio broadcasting.

Description: TELEVISION PROGRAMMING AND BROADCASTING
Television Programming and Broadcasting
Television programming and broadcasting (including cable, satellite, terrestrial television, internet and mobile)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of creating television content on entertainment, news, talk, and the like or acquiring the right to distribute these content and subsequently broadcasting these content. The complete television programme can be either broadcast by the producing unit or produced for transmission by third party distributors, such as cable companies or satellite television providers. The programming may be of a general or specialised nature (e.g. limited formats such as news, sports, education or youth oriented programming), may be made freely available to users or may be available only on a subscription basis. Also included is data broadcasting, typically integrated with television broadcasting. The broadcasting can be performed using different technologies, over-the-air, via satellite, via a cable network or via Internet. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•creation of a complete television channel programme, from purchased programme components (e.g. movies, documentaries), self-produced programme components (e.g. local news, live reports) or a combination thereof
•programming of video-on-demand channels
•data broadcasting integrated with television broadcasting
•video streaming via internet

Description: TELECOMMUNICATIONS
TELECOMMUNICATIONS
Telecommunications Network Operation
Wired telecommunications network operation (including fixed-line, fibre optics, local/international PSTN and leased circuits)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound and video using wired telecommunications infrastructure, including:
- operating and maintaining switching and transmission facilities to provide point-to-point communications via landlines, microwave or a combination of landlines and satellite linkups
- operating of cable distribution systems (e.g. for distribution of data and television signals)
- furnishing telegraph and other non-vocal communications using own facilities
•purchasing access and network capacity from owners and operators of networks and providing telecommunications services using this capacity to businesses and households
•fixed lines services (including local/international PSTN and leased circuit)

The transmission facilities that carry out these activities, may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies.

Description: Mobile cellular and other wireless telecommunications network operation
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound, and video using wireless telecommunications infrastructure
•maintaining and operating mobile cellular and other wireless telecommunications networks
•purchasing access and network capacity from owners and operators of networks and providing wireless telecommunications services (except satellite) using this capacity to businesses and households
The transmission facilities provide omni-directional transmission via airwaves and may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies.

Description: Satellite telecommunications network operation
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, sound and video using satellite telecommunications infrastructure
•delivery of visual, aural or textual programming received from cable networks, local television stations or radio networks to consumers via direct-to-home satellite systems (The units classified here do not generally originate programming material.)
•purchasing access and network capacity from owners and operators of networks and providing telecommunications services using this capacity to businesses and households

Description: Other Telecommunications Activities
Telecommunications resellers/third party telecommunications providers (including value-added network operators)
Definition: This Sub-class includes services provided by telecommunications resellers (i.e. purchasing and reselling network capacity without providing additional services).

Description: Internet access providers, include ISPs
Definition: This Sub-class includes Internet access providers.

Description: Other telecommunications activities n.e.c. (e.g. provision of VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol services))
Definition: This Sub-class includes other telecommunications activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•operation of satellite terminal stations and associated facilities operationally connected with one or more terrestrial communications systems and capable of transmitting •telecommunications to or receiving telecommunications from satellite systems
•provision of telecommunications services (such as transmission of voice, data, text, sound and video) over existing telecom connections e.g. VoIP (Voice Over Internet Protocol) provision
•provision of telephone and internet access in facilities open to the public (e.g. cyber ‘cafes’ that offer only internet access)

Description: COMPUTER PROGRAMMING, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY CONSULTANCY AND RELATED ACTIVITIES
COMPUTER PROGRAMMING, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY CONSULTANCY AND RELATED ACTIVITIES
Computer Programming Activities
Development of software and applications (except games and cybersecurity)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes 
•activities of providing expertise in the field of information technologies such as writing, modifying, testing and supporting software, designing the structure and content of, or writing the computer code necessary to create, implement, develop or customise software applications (including updates and patches), databases or webpages
•customising of software or applications, i.e. modifying and configuring an existing software or applications so that it is functional within the clients' information system environment
•development of mobile applications

Description: Development of computer games
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of providing expertise in the field of information technologies such as writing, modifying, testing and supporting software, designing the structure and content of, or writing the computer code necessary to create, implement, develop or customise computer games software and applications (including updates and patches).

Description: Development of software for cybersecurity
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of providing expertise in the field of information technologies such as writing, modifying, testing and supporting software, designing the structure and content of, or writing the computer code necessary to create, implement, develop or customise software and applications for cybersecurity (including updates and patches).

Description: Information Technology Consultancy and Computer Facilities Management Activities
Information technology consultancy (except cybersecurity)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•planning and designing of computer systems that integrate computer hardware, software and communication technologies
•provision of the hardware and software components of the system as part of their integrated services or these components may be provided by third parties or vendors
•installation of the computer system
•training and support for users of the computer system
•computer system integration design services

Description: Information technology cybersecurity consultancy
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•planning and designing of computer systems that integrate cybersecurity computer hardware, software and communication technologies
•provision of the cybersecurity hardware and software components of the system as part of their integrated services or these components may be provided by third parties or vendors
•installation of the cybersecurity computer system
•training and support for users of the cybersecurity computer system
•cybersecurity computer system integration design services
•services to assess, analyse and improve the efficiency of cybersecurity IT operations

Description: Computer facilities management activities
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of on-site management and operation of clients' computer systems or data processing facilities as well as related support services (e.g. monitoring or remote monitoring of clients' IT computer systems or data processing facilities)

Description: Other Information Technology and Computer Service Activities
Other information technology and computer service activities (e.g. disaster recovery services)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes other information technology and computer related activities not elsewhere classified, for instance:
•computer disaster recovery
•installation (setting-up) of personal computers
•software installation

Description: INFORMATION SERVICE ACTIVITIES AND ONLINE MARKETPLACES
DATA ANALYTICS, PROCESSING, HOSTING AND RELATED ACTIVITIES; INTERNET SEARCH ENGINES
Data Analytics Processing, Hosting and Related Activities
Data centres
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision and management of data centre services.

Description: Hosting services by non-data centres
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of hosting services by non-data centres (e.g. web hosting, cloud hosting, application hosting).

Description: Data analytics, processing and related activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes data analytics, processing and related activities that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•cryptocurrency cloud mining service
•application service providers
•data entry service

Description: Internet Search Engines
Internet search engines
Definition: This Sub-class includes internet search engines. Additional Internet services, such as e-mail, connections to other web sites, news, and other limited content, and serve as a home base for Internet users might also be provided.

Description: ONLINE MARKETPLACES
Online Marketplaces
Online marketplaces for goods (including food)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•operation of Business-to-Consumer (B2C) and Business-to-Business (B2B) online marketplaces for goods (including food) on a fee or commission basis
•operation of Consumer-to-Consumer (C2C) online marketplaces for cooked food

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers usually for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for goods and cooked food sold through their platforms, without preparing the cooked food or taking ownership of the goods sold.

Description: Online marketplaces for health services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of online marketplaces for health services on a fee or commission basis. 

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for health services sold through their platforms, without providing the health services sold.

Description: Online marketplaces for education services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of online marketplaces for education services on a fee or commission basis. 

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for education services sold through their platforms, without providing the education services sold.

Description: Online marketplaces for travel services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of online marketplaces for travel services on a fee or commission basis. 

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for travel services sold through their platforms, without providing the travel services sold.

Description: Online marketplaces for real estate services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of online marketplaces for real estate services on a fee or commission basis. 

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for real estate services sold through their platforms, without providing the real estate services.

Description: Online marketplaces for services n.e.c.
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of online marketplaces for services on a fee or commission basis not elsewhere classified. 

Online marketplaces are intermediary platforms that enable transactions between buyers and sellers for a fee or on a commission basis. The online marketplaces facilitate the orders for services sold through their platforms, without providing the services sold.
Examples:
•online marketplaces for construction services and related activities
•online marketplaces for legal, arbitration and mediation services
•online marketplaces for accounting and auditing services, taxation advisory services, book-keeping services
•online ticketing agencies for arts, sports and entertainment activities

Description: OTHER INFORMATION SERVICE ACTIVITIES
Other Information Service Activities
News agency activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•news agencies, news syndicate and news agency activities furnishing news, pictures and features to the media
•news clipping services, press clipping services, etc.

Description: Other information service activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes all other information service activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•telephone based information services
•information search services on a contract or fee basis

Description: FINANCIAL AND INSURANCE ACTIVITIES
FINANCIAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES, EXCEPT INSURANCE AND PENSION FUNDING
MONETARY INTERMEDIATION
Central Bank
Central bank
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•issuing and managing the country’s currency
•monitoring and control of the money supply
•conducting of monetary policy
•taking deposits that are used for clearance between financial institutions
•supervising banking operations
•oversight of payment systems
•serving as banker and financial agent to the government
•holding the country’s international reserves

Description: Full Banks
Full banks
Definition: This Sub-class includes all local and foreign banks that hold a Full Bank license granted by the Monetary Authority of Singapore under the Banking Act which permits them to conduct the whole range of banking services.

Description: Wholesale Banks
Wholesale banks
Definition: This Sub-class includes foreign banks that hold a Wholesale Bank license and operate within the Guidelines for Operations of Wholesale Banks issued by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. Wholesale banks may engage in the same range of banking business as full banks, except they do not carry out Singapore Dollar retail banking activities.

Description: Merchant Banks
Merchant banks
Definition: This Sub-class includes banks that are approved under the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) Act and operate within the Guidelines for Operation of Merchant Banks. Typical activities include corporate finance, underwriting of share and bond issues, mergers and acquisitions, portfolio investment management, consultancy and other fee-based activities.

Description: Finance Companies
Finance companies (with deposit taking functions)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes finance companies that are licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and governed by the Finance Companies Act. These units are involved in providing fixed and saving deposits as well as credit facilities to individuals and corporations. 

Units in this Sub-class may not:
•offer deposit accounts which are repayable on demand by cheque, draft or order
•grant unsecured credit facilities to any person or body of persons, which in the aggregate and outstanding at any one time exceeds S$5,000
•deal in any foreign currency, gold or other precious metals or acquire foreign currency denominated stocks, shares or debt securities

Description: Other Monetary Intermediation
Other monetary intermediation
Definition: This Sub-class includes monetary intermediation activities other than those conducted by monetary institutions. Also included are firms that issue digital payment tokens.

Description: ACTIVITIES OF HOLDING COMPANIES
Activities of Holding Companies
Bank/Financial holding companies (including insurance holding company)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the activities of bank/financial holding companies, i.e. units that hold the assets (owning controlling-levels of equity) of a group of subsidiary corporations and whose principal activity is owning the group. The holding companies in this Sub-class generally do not provide any other service to the businesses in which the equity is held, i.e. they do not administer or manage other units.

Description: Other holding companies
Definition: This Sub-class includes holding companies (e.g. real estate, construction, production, distribution) that hold the assets (owning controlling-levels of equity) of a group of subsidiary corporations and whose principal activity is owning the group. The holding companies in this Sub-class generally do not administer or manage the other businesses in which the equity is held.

Description: TRUSTS, FUNDS AND SIMILAR FINANCIAL ENTITIES
Trusts, Funds and Similar Financial Entities
Trusts, funds and similar financial entities (e.g. collective portfolio investment funds (excluding those with rental income))
Definition:
This Sub-class includes legal entities organised to pool securities or other financial assets, without managing, on behalf of shareholders or beneficiaries. The portfolios are customised to achieve specific investment characteristics, such as diversification, risk, rate of return and price volatility. These entities earn interest, dividends and other property income, but have little or no employment and no revenue from the sale of services.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•open-end investment funds
•closed-end investment funds
•trusts, estates or agency accounts, administered on behalf of the beneficiaries under the terms of a trust agreement, will or agency agreement
•unit investment trust funds
•personal investment holding companies, units for holding and managing wealth of individuals and families
•business trusts with mainly dividend income

Description: OTHER FINANCIAL SERVICES ACTIVITIES, EXCEPT INSURANCE AND PENSION FUNDING ACTIVITIES
Financial Leasing
Financial leasing companies
Definition:
This Sub-class includes leasing where the term approximately covers the expected life of the asset and the lessee acquires substantially all the benefits of its use and takes all the risks associated with its ownership. Such leases cover all or virtually all costs including interest.

Finance leasing differs from rental business in that units engaged in rental business keep stock of and take title to the goods they rent. However, units engaged in finance leasing do not keep stock of the goods they leased. Instead, they finance their clients in the purchase of machinery or equipment from outlets of clients' choice. The finance leasing companies (lessor) maintains ownership of the asset. After the terms of leasing expire, the ownership of the goods may or may not be transferred to the clients (lessee).

Description: Other Credit Granting
Thrift and loan societies and credit associations
Definition: This Sub-class includes financial loan activities by thrift and loan societies or credit associations.

Description: Credit card services
Definition: This Sub-class includes financial service activities where the granting of credit is in the form of issuing of credit cards.

Description: Mutual benefits organisations
Definition: This Sub-class includes financial service activities where the granting of credit by mutual benefits organisations.

Description: Money-lending
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•money lending outside the banking system
•personal loan companies

Description: Pawnbrokerage
Definition: This Sub-class includes pawnshops and pawnbrokers.

Description: Other credit agencies n.e.c. (e.g. motor finance)
Definition: This Sub-class includes financial service activities by credit agencies not involved in monetary intermediation that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•finance company without depository functions
•motor financing
•international trade financing

Description: Financial Service Activities, except Insurance and Pension Funding Activities n.e.c.
Factoring companies
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•factoring activities
•debt factoring and invoice discounting

Description: Representative offices of foreign banks
Definition: This Sub-class includes local representative offices of foreign banks

Description: Remittance services
Definition: This Sub-class includes remittance services.

Description: Treasury centres
Definition: This Sub-class includes centralised treasury management activities, such as by treasury centres.

Description: Other financial service activities, except insurance and pension funding activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes all other financial services not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•writing of swaps, options and other hedging arrangements
•activities of viatical settlement companies
•own-account investment activities, such as by securitisation companies, investment clubs, angel investors, etc.

Description: INSURANCE, REINSURANCE, PROVIDENT FUNDING AND PENSION FUNDING
INSURANCE UNDERWRITING
Life Insurance (Insurance Underwriting)
Life insurance
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the underwriting of annuities and life insurance policies and investing premiums to build a portfolio of financial assets to be used against future claims.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•underwriting and provision of:
- annuities and life insurance policies
- disability income insurance policies
- accidental death and dismemberment insurance policies (with or without substantial savings element)

Description: General Insurance (Insurance Underwriting)
Marine insurance
Definition: This Sub-class includes the underwriting and provision of marine insurance policies.

Description: Captive insurance
Definition: This Sub-class includes the underwriting and provision of captive insurance policies.

Description: Import, export and credit insurance
Definition: This Sub-class includes the underwriting and provision of import, export and credit insurance policies.

Description: General insurance (except marine and import, export & credit insurance)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the underwriting of non-life insurance policies.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in:
•underwriting and provision of:
- accident and fire insurance
- health insurance
- travel insurance
- property insurance
- pecuniary loss and liability insurance
- motor insurance

Description: REINSURANCE UNDERWRITING
Reinsurance
Life reinsurance
Definition: This Sub-class includes the underwriting and provision of life reinsurance policies (i.e. assuming all or part of the risk associated with existing life insurance policies originally underwritten by other insurance carriers).

Description: General reinsurance
Definition: This Sub-class includes underwriting and provision of non-life reinsurance policies (i.e. assuming all or part of the risk associated with existing non-life insurance policies originally underwritten by other insurance carriers).

Description: PROVIDENT AND PENSION FUNDING
Provident and Pension Funding
Provident funding
Definition: This Sub-class includes administration of provident funds.

Description: Pension funding
Definition: This Sub-class includes administration of pension funds.

Description: ACTIVITIES AUXILIARY TO FINANCIAL SERVICE AND INSURANCE ACTIVITIES
ACTIVITIES AUXILIARY TO FINANCIAL SERVICE ACTIVITIES, EXCEPT INSURANCE AND PENSION FUNDING
Securities and commodities exchange
Securities and commodities exchange
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation and supervision of financial markets other than by public authorities, such as:
•commodity contracts exchanges
•futures contracts exchanges
•securities exchanges
•stock exchanges
•stock or commodity options exchanges

Description: Security and Commodity Contracts Brokerage
Stock, share and bond brokers and dealers
Definition: This Sub-class includes dealing in financial markets on behalf of others (e.g. stock, share or bond brokers or dealers) and related activities.

Description: Foreign exchange brokers and dealers
Definition: This Sub-class includes foreign exchange brokers or dealers.

Description: Gold bullion brokers and dealers
Definition: This Sub-class includes gold bullion brokers or dealers.

Description: Commodity (excluding gold) and futures brokers and dealers
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•commodities contracts brokerage (e.g.silver bullion, platinum bullion)
•futures contracts brokerage

Description: Carbon credit brokers/traders
Definition: This Sub-class includes carbon credit traders or brokers.

Description: Money-changing services
Definition: This Sub-class includes money-changing services.

Description: Security dealings and commodity contracts brokerage activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes security dealings and commodity contracts brokerage activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•trading of virtual currency, including cryptocurrency
•trading or operating of trading platforms for digital tokens which constitute securities, derivatives contracts or units in a collective investment scheme (CIS)

Description: Other Activities Auxiliary to Financial Service Activities
Trustee, fiduciary and custody services firms (including nominee companies, trustees and REIT trustees)
Definition: This Sub-class includes trustee fiduciary and custody services (e.g. nominee companies, trustees, REIT trustees).

Description: Corporate finance advisory services
Definition: This Sub-class includes corporate finance advisory services.

Description: Clearing and settlement of financial instruments
Definition: This Sub-class includes clearing and settlement activities other than credit card transactions.

Description: Activities auxiliary to fund management activities (e.g. independent fund administration firms)
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities auxiliary to fund management activities (e.g. fund administration).

Description: Transaction/Payment processing services
Definition: This Sub-class includes financial transaction processing for credit card transactions. Also included are provision of digital custodian wallet services, i.e. the service of safekeeping and administration of digital payment tokens or instruments allowing user to transfer or receive digital payment tokens.

Description: Other activities auxiliary to financial service activities n.e.c. (e.g. mortgage advisory firms)
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities auxiliary to financial service activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•activities of mortgage advisers and brokers
•investment advisory service (non-insurance)
•buying/selling of cryptocurrencies (including cryptocurrency trading platforms)

Description: ACTIVITIES AUXILIARY TO INSURANCE AND PENSION FUNDING
Risk and Damage Evaluation
Risk and damage evaluation (e.g. loss adjusting, claims adjusting)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of administration services of insurance, such as assessing and settling insurance claims.

This Sub-class includes:
•assessing insurance claims:
- claims adjusting
- risk assessing
- risk and damage evaluation
- average and loss adjusting
•settling insurance claims

Description: Activities of Insurance Intermediaries
Insurance agencies and agents (including financial planning services)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•activities of firms providing financial planning or advisory services
•activities of insurance agencies or agents in selling, negotiating or soliciting of annuities, insurance or reinsurance policies

Description: Insurance brokers
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of insurance brokers (i.e. insurance intermediaries) in selling, negotiating or soliciting of annuities, insurance and reinsurance policies.

Description: Other Activities Auxiliary to Insurance and Pension Funding
Representative offices of foreign insurers and professional reinsurers
Definition: This Sub-class includes representative office of foreign insurers and professional reinsurers.

Description: Captive managers
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of captive managers.

Description: Other activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding n.e.c. (e.g. activities of actuaries)
Definition: This Sub-class includes other activities auxiliary to insurance and pension funding not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•activities involved in or closely related to insurance and pension funding (except claims adjusting, activities of insurance agents and firms providing financial planning services)
•salvage administration
•actuarial services

Description: FUND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES
Fund Management Activities
Traditional/Long-only asset/Portfolio management
Definition: This Sub-class includes the management of traditional/long-only asset/portfolio funds (i.e. invest primarily in equity, fixed income and cash equivalents) for individuals, businesses and others on a fee or contract basis.

Description: Hedge fund management
Definition: This Sub-class includes the management of hedge funds for individuals, businesses and others on a fee or contract basis.

Description: Property fund management (including REIT management and direct property fund management)
Definition: This Sub-class includes management of real estate investment trusts (REITs) and direct property funds for individuals, businesses and others on a fee or contract basis.

Description: Private equity firms
Definition: This Sub-class includes the management of private equity funds for individuals, businesses and others on a fee or contract basis.

Description: Venture capital activities
Definition: This Sub-class includes venture capital activities.

Description: Single/Multiple family offices activities (e.g. managing investments and trusts for a single or multiple families)
Definition: This Sub-class includes fund management activities performed for a single or multiple families on a fee or contract basis, such as management of fund, investments and trusts.

Description: Private debt funds
Definition: This Sub-class includes private debt funds.

Description: Fund management activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes portfolio and fund management activities for individuals, businesses and others on a fee or contract basis that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•management of other investment funds
•management of shipping trusts
•management of pension funds
•management of collective portfolio investment funds

Description: REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES
REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES
REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES WITH OWN OR LEASED PROPERTY
Real Estate Activities with Own or Leased Property
Real estate developers
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the development of land with the eventual aim of selling the residential or commercial properties
•buying or selling of properties or land

Description: Operating of serviced apartments
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of homes and furnished or unfurnished flats or apartments for more permanent use (e.g. monthly or annual basis).

Description: Letting of self-owned or leased real estate property except food courts, coffee shops and canteens (e.g. office/exhibition space, shopping mall, self-storage facilities)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the rental and operating of self-owned or leased real estate, for example:
•apartment buildings and dwellings
•non-residential buildings (i.e. offices, shopping malls), including exhibition halls
•self-storage facilities 
•land

Description: Letting and operating of self-owned or leased food courts, coffee shops and canteens (with mainly rental income)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the rental and operating of self-owned or leased food courts, coffee shops and canteens. Units under this Sub-class have their main source of revenue from rental income.

Description: Collective portfolio investment funds with rental income
Definition: This Sub-class includes the management of collective portfolio investment funds (e.g. Real Estate investment Trust (REITS)) with main income from the rental of premises.

Description: Management of self-owned strata titled property (i.e. Management Corporation Strata Title)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the management of self-owned strata titled property (i.e. Management Corporation Strata Title).

Description: REAL ESTATE ACTIVITIES ON A FEE OR COMMISSION BASIS
Real Estate Activities on a Fee or Commission Basis
Real estate agencies and valuation services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•activities of real estate agencies
•real estate appraisal or valuation services

Description: Town councils
Definition: This Sub-class includes the activities of town councils (i.e. controlling, managing, maintaining and improving the common property of public housing residential flats and commercial property within the town).

Description: Residential (other than town councils), commercial and industrial real estate management
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of real estate residential (other than town councils) and non-residential management services on a fee or commission basis, which may be in combination with cleaning, maintenance and security services within client’s premises.

Description: Real estate activities on a fee or commission basis n.e.c. (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of other real estate related activities on a fee or contract basis not elsewhere classified.
Examples: •real estate consultancy

Description: PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL ACTIVITIES
LEGAL AND ACCOUNTING ACTIVITIES
LEGAL ACTIVITIES
Legal Activities
Legal activities (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes legal advice, representation and related legal services by, or under supervision of, persons who are members of the bar as part of legal procedure in courts or other judicial bodies.

Units in this Sub-class are engaged in one or more of the following: 
•advice, representation and related legal services in all areas of law (e.g. criminal law, civil law, administrative law, labour disputes, and arbitration and mediation as part of legal procedure)
•provision of general legal counsel or legal advice and other related legal services
•preparation or certification of legal documents (e.g. articles of incorporation, partnership agreements or similar documents in connection with company formation, patents, trade marks and copyrights, preparation of deeds, wills, trusts, etc.) and other related legal services
•other activities of notaries public, civil law notaries, bailiffs, arbitrators and mediators, examiners and referees

Description: Arbitration and mediation services (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes arbitration and mediation services provided by quasi-judicial or non-judicial bodies aimed at settling disputes among businesses or individuals.

Description: ACCOUNTING, BOOK-KEEPING AND AUDITING ACTIVITIES; TAX CONSULTANCY
Accounting, Book-Keeping and Auditing Activities; Tax Consultancy
Accounting and auditing services (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes accounting and auditing services.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•preparation of management accounting reports
•preparation or auditing of financial accounts
•examination of accounts and certification of their accuracy
•preparation of personal and business income tax returns
•advisory activities and representation on behalf of clients before tax authorities
•advisory services relating to audit and assurance
•accounting advisory and consultancy services (e.g. business valuation)
•business assurance services such as internal audit, restructuring or insolvency, risk management or governance and corporate finance or deal advisory

Description: Book-keeping services (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes book-keeping services (i.e. recording of commercial transactions from businesses or others).

Description: ACTIVITIES OF HEAD OFFICES; MANAGEMENT CONSULTANCY ACTIVITIES
ACTIVITIES OF HEAD OFFICES; CENTRALISED ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES AND BUSINESS REPRESENTATIVE OFFICES
Activities of Head Offices; Centralised Administrative Offices and Business Representative Offices
Activities of head and regional head offices; Centralised administrative offices and subsidiary management offices
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the overseeing and managing their related company or enterprise (both locally and overseas), such as undertaking the strategic planning, decision making, operational control of these related company or enterprise and may provide a range of administrative services (e.g. marketing, recruitment, finance) to these related companies or enterprises only. 

These units are often known as head or regional head offices.

Description: Business representative offices
Definition: This Sub-class includes units primarily set-up to assess business opportunities, liaison, coordination and promotional activities in Singapore and the region for a related foreign commercial entity. These units generally do not engaged in commercial activities in Singapore.

Description: MANAGEMENT CONSULTANCY ACTIVITIES
Management Consultancy Activities
Management consultancy services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance to businesses, the public service and other organisations (excluding healthcare organisations and hotels) on a range of management and operational issues, such as:
•strategic and organisational planning
•production scheduling and control planning
•management information
•practices and planning

Description: Management consultancy services for healthcare organisations
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance to healthcare organisations on a range of management and operational issues.

Description: Management consultancy services for hotels
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance to hotels on a range of management and operational issues, such as:
•strategic and organisational planning
•practices and planning
•production scheduling and control planning
•management information

Description: Human resource consultancy services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance on management and operational issues related to human resource such as:
•employee compensation
•labour relations
•human resource policies

Description: Public relations, marketing and brand consultancy services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance on management and operational issues related to public relations, marketing and brand consultancy.

Description: Port, shipping and maritime-related consultancy services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of advice and guidance on management and operational issues related to port, shipping and maritime-related services.

Description: Management consultancy services n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes management consultancy services that are not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•consultancy on aviation 
•consultancy on corporate immigration
•consultancy on workplace safety

Description: ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING ACTIVITIES; TECHNICAL TESTING AND ANALYSIS
ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING ACTIVITIES AND RELATED TECHNICAL CONSULTANCY
Architectural and Surveying Activities
Architectural services
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of architectural services in planning and designing residential, institutional, leisure, commercial, and industrial buildings and structures by applying knowledge of design, construction procedures, building codes, and building material.

Description: Landscape design and landscape architecture
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of landscape design and landscape architecture services, including the planning and designing the development of land areas for projects, such as parks and other recreational areas; airports; highways; hospitals; schools; land subdivisions; and commercial, industrial, and residential areas, by applying knowledge of land characteristics, location of buildings and structures, use of land areas, and design of landscape projects.

Description: Quantity surveying services
Definition: This Sub-class includes quantity surveying services.

Description: Land surveying services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes land surveying services.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•conducting of cadastral survey and strata survey
•conducting of geodetic survey
•conducting of topographical survey
•conducting of photogrammetry mapping (airborne and terrestrial)
•conducting of 2D or 3D Mapping (including using laser scanning or drone)
•conducting of engineering survey (including setting out survey, tunnels monitoring, ground monitoring)

Description: Other surveying services n.e.c. (e.g. geophysical, geologic, seismic, hydrographic surveying services)
Definition: This Sub-class includes other surveying services that are not elsewhere classified such as geophysical, geologic, seismic and hydrographic surveying.
Examples:
•geologic surveying
•geophysical surveying
•hydrographic surveying

Description: Engineering Design and Consultancy Activities
General building engineering design and consultancy services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes :
•general building engineering design (i.e. applying physical laws and principles of engineering in the engineering project). Other services related to the engineering project may be provided as well, for example: provision of advice regarding engineering principles and methods, preparation of feasibility studies, preparation of preliminary and final plans and designs, provision of technical services during the construction or installation phase, inspection and evaluation of the project.

•general building engineering project development and management

Description: Process and industrial plant engineering design and consultancy services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•process and industrial plant engineering design (i.e. applying physical laws and principles of engineering in the engineering project). Other services related to the engineering project may be provided as well, for example: provision of advice regarding engineering principles and methods, preparation of feasibility studies, preparation of preliminary and final plans and designs, provision of technical services during the construction or installation phase, inspection and evaluation of the project.
•process and industrial plant engineering technical consultancy services (i.e. provision of advice to clients regarding engineering principles and methods)
•process and industrial plant engineering project development and management
•engineering services related to the design of process and industrial products (e.g. industrial machinery used across various sectors like agricultural, construction, mining, metalworking, commercial and service industry, heating, ventilating and air-conditioning, etc.)

Description: Engineering design and consultancy services in energy management and clean energy systems
Definition:
This Sub-class includes engineering design and consultancy services in energy management and clean energy systems such as:
•hydropower
•solar photovoltaics
•wind energy
•systems that generate electrical power using fossil fuels

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•energy management and clean energy systems engineering design (i.e. applying physical laws and principles of engineering in the engineering project). Other services related to the engineering project may be provided as well, for example: provision of advice, preparation of feasibility studies, preparation of preliminary and final plans and designs, provision of technical services during the construction or installation phase, inspection and evaluation of the project.
•energy management and clean energy systems engineering technical consultancy services (i.e. provision of advice to clients regarding engineering principles and methods)
•energy management and clean energy systems engineering project development and management

Description: Environmental engineering design and consultancy services (except clean energy)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes environment engineering design and consultancy services such as:
•water supply and treatment systems
•waste treatment systems (e.g. sewer systems, sewage treatment plants)
•erosion control systems
•waste water treatment and disposal systems
•waste management systems (e.g. recycling facilities, landfill sites)

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:

Executive, legislative and other general public administration (e.g. Istana, parliament, tax authority)
