This Sub-class includes the executive, legislative and other general public administration of local bodies.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•administration and supervision of fiscal affairs
- operation of taxation schemes 
- duty/tax collection on goods and tax violation investigation
- customs administration
•budget implementation and management of public funds and public debt
- raising and receiving of money and control of their disbursement
•administration and operation of national statistical services

Description: Public Administration of Economic and Social Programmes
Public administration of economic and social programmes
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the public administration of economic and social programmes for the following areas:
- agriculture
- land use
- energy and mining 
- resources
- infrastructure
- transport
- communication
- hotels and tourism
- wholesale and retail trade
- health
- education
- culture
- sport
- recreation
- environment
- housing
- social services
•administration of R&D policies and associated funds to these areas
•administration of general labour affairs

Description: PROVISION OF SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE
Foreign Affairs
Foreign affairs
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•administration and operation of the ministry of foreign affairs and diplomatic and consular missions stationed abroad or at offices of international organisations
•aid to foreign countries, whether or not routed through international organisations

Description: Defence Activities
Armed forces
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•administration, supervision and operation of military defence affairs and land, sea, air and space defence forces
- combat forces of army, navy and air force
- engineering, transport, communications, intelligence, material, personnel and other non-combat forces and commands
- reserve and auxiliary forces of the defence establishment
- military logistics (provision of equipment, structures, supplies, etc.)
- health activities for military personnel in the field

Description: Defence activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes other supporting services related to military defence affairs and national security needs of Singapore not elsewhere classified.
Examples: •administration of defence-related R&D policies and related funds

Description: Public Order and Safety Activities
Judiciary and related services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•administration and operation of administrative civil and criminal law courts, military tribunals and the judicial system, including legal representation and advice on behalf of the government or when provided by the government in cash or services
•rendering of judgements and interpretations of the law, arbitration and mediation of civil actions

Description: Police
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•administration and operation of police forces supported by public authorities
•the forces may be deployed at port, border, coastguards and includes special police forces. Duties include traffic regulation, illegal immigrant investigation or maintenance of arrest records

Description: Prisons
Definition: This Sub-class includes prison administration by public authorities.

Description: Other places of detention, correction and rehabilitation
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of correctional services, including rehabilitation services, regardless of whether their administration and operation is done by government units or by private units on a contract or fee basis.

Description: Civil defence
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•fire-fighting and fire prevention services
•administration and operation of regular and auxiliary fire brigades in fire prevention, fire-fighting, rescue of persons and animals, assistance in civic disasters, road accidents, etc.
•provision of supplies for domestic emergency use in case of peacetime disasters and Community Emergency And Engagement (C2E) Committees

Description: Public order and safety activities n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the administration and operation of other public order and safety activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples: •fishing inspection, protection and patrol services

Description: EDUCATION
EDUCATION
PRE-PRIMARY AND PRIMARY EDUCATION
Pre-Primary and Primary Education
Nurseries and kindergartens
Definition: This Sub-class includes nurseries and kindergartens. Pre-primary education is defined as the initial stage of organised instruction designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment, that is, to provide a bridge between the home and a school-based atmosphere.

Description: Primary schools
Definition: This Sub-class includes primary schools. These education courses aim to give students a sound basic education in reading, writing and mathematics and an elementary understanding of other subjects such as history, geography, natural science, social science, art and music. Such education is generally provided for children, however the provision of literacy programmes within or outside the school system, which are similar in content to programmes in primary education but are intended for those considered too old to enter elementary schools, is also included (i.e. adult literacy programmes).

Description: SECONDARY AND POST-SECONDARY NON-TERTIARY EDUCATION
General Secondary and Post-Secondary Non-Tertiary Education
Secondary schools including combined primary and secondary schools
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of education service at the secondary level, giving access to post-secondary (non-tertiary) or higher education. Such units provide programmes that are usually on a more subject-oriented pattern using more specialised teachers, and more often employ several teachers conducting classes in their field of specialisation. 
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)
•programmes at this level are usually designated to qualify students either for post-secondary (non-tertiary) education or higher education

Description: Junior colleges and centralised pre-university institutes (post-secondary non-tertiary) including combined secondary schools and post-secondary non-tertiary schools
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of education service at the post-secondary (non-tertiary) level, giving access to higher education. Such units provide programmes that are usually on a more subject-oriented pattern using more specialised teachers, and more often employ several teachers conducting classes in their field of specialisation. 
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)
•programmes at this level are designated for access to higher education

Description: Commercial schools offering general secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary education programmes
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•commercial schools offering general secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary levels education programmes. Such units provide programmes that are usually on a more subject-oriented pattern using more specialised teachers, and more often employ several teachers conducting classes in their field of specialisation
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)

Description: Technical and Vocational (Secondary and Post-Secondary Non-Tertiary) Education
Technical and vocational secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary education
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•firms providing pre-employment technical and vocational education. Instruction may be provided in diverse settings, such as the firm’s training facilities, educational institutions, the workplace, or through correspondence, television, Internet, or other means
• the pre-employment training can be delivered by:
- technical and vocational education
- specialised trade schools

Description: International and Foreign System Schools
International and foreign system schools
Definition: This Sub-class includes international and foreign system schools.

Description: Schools for Special Needs
Schools for special needs
Definition: This Sub-class includes include schools providing education for students with special needs.

Description: Specialised Education Schools
Specialised education schools
Definition: This Sub-class includes schools that offer predominately specialised education in specific fields (e.g. arts, performing arts, sports, mathematics and science, applied learning) up to the post-secondary non-tertiary education level.

Description: HIGHER EDUCATION
Higher Education
Polytechnics
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•polytechnics that are primarily engaged in the provision of higher education (i.e. at least diploma level)
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)

Description: Universities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•universities that are primarily engaged in the provision of higher education (i.e. at least graduate level)
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)

Description: Teachers' training institute
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•teachers' training institutes primarily engaged in the provision of higher education (i.e. at least diploma) for teachers

Description: Commercial schools offering higher education programmes
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•commercial schools primarily engaged in the provision of higher education (i.e. at least diploma)
•education can be provided through various channels (e.g. classrooms, Internet, at home)

Description: OTHER EDUCATION
Other Education
Training courses for construction, real estate, security and investigation services, cleaning, landscaping, waste management and pest management
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•building and construction (including architecture and engineering services)
•real estate related services (e.g. real estate development, real estate management, real estate agency)
•security and investigation services
•cleaning (e.g. domestic, environmental, industrial) and landscaping services
•waste management (e.g. waste collection, treatment and disposal services; materials recovery)
•water collection, purification and desalination
•pest management (e.g. pest control and fumigation)

Description: Training courses for healthcare, education, community and social services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•healthcare 
•teaching pedagogy
•community and social services

Description: Training courses for food and beverage, retail and accommodation, tour operators, travel agencies & travel-related reservation services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•food and beverage services
•retail trade
•hotel and accommodation (e.g. hotels, chalets, backpacker hostels, capsule hotels, student hostel, worker dormitories, etc.)
•tour operations, travel agency and travel-related reservation services (e.g. hotel booking, taxi or airplane booking)

Description: Training courses for manufacturing
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•manufacturing 
•electricity and gas production
•crude petroleum and natural gas extraction and production

Description: Training courses for information and communications, finance and professional services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•information, communications and technology (e.g. telecommunications, information technology software development)
•broadcasting (e.g. motion picture production, radio programme production)
•publishing, printing and printing-related services (e.g. typesetting, colour separation, book binding, etc.)
•reproduction of recorded media
•financial services (e.g. banking and finance)
•insurance
•legal services
•engineering, architectural services, quantity surveying, technical testing and analysis
•accountancy and audit management
•research and development (e.g. biotechnology research and development)
•design (e.g. fashion design and industrial design) 
•workplace safety and health
•risk management
•human resource (employment and recruitment)
•leadership and people management
•personal development
•advertising, sales and marketing

Description: Training courses for wholesale trade, logistics and transport
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of training courses in the following areas:
•wholesale trade
•logistics (e.g. warehousing and storage)
•land, air and sea transport services
•marine port management
•airport management
•carpark operation and management services

Description: Training courses for sports and games
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of instruction in athletic activities to groups or individuals for hobby, recreation or self-development purposes. Overnight and day sports instruction camps are also included. 
•instruction may be provided in diverse settings, such as the unit’s or client’s training facilities, educational institutions or by other means. Instruction provided in this class is formally organised
• Examples of courses taught are:
- sports instruction (baseball, basketball, cricket, football, etc.)
- camps, sports instruction
- cheerleading instruction
- gymnastics instruction
- riding instruction or schools
- swimming instruction
- professional sports instructors, teachers, coaches
- martial arts instruction
- chess instruction 
- contract bridge instruction
- yoga instruction

Description: Training courses for music, dancing, art, speech and drama
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of instruction in the arts, drama and music to students of all ages. They provide formally organised instruction, mainly for hobby, recreational or self-development purposes. Such instruction does not lead to formal academic qualifications.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•piano teachers and other music instruction
•art instruction
•dance instruction and dance studios
•speech and drama schools (non-academic)
•fine arts schools (non-academic)
•performing arts schools (non-academic)
•photography schools (non-academic)

Description: Training courses n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of general training courses that are not elsewhere classified, such as: customer service, procurement and purchasing.
Examples:
•training courses for agriculture
•training courses for customer service
•training courses for procurement

Description: EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT SERVICES
Educational Support Services
Student recruitment agencies
Definition: This Sub-class includes the services of student recruitment agencies.

Description: Examination and accreditation agencies for education services
Definition: This Sub-class includes services of educational testing and accreditation services. Such services are non-instructional and are to support educational processes or systems.

Description: Educational support services n.e.c. (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes non-instructional services that support educational processes or systems not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•organisation of student exchange programmes
•tuition matching service
•educational guidance and counselling services

Description: HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES
HEALTH SERVICES
HOSPITAL ACTIVITIES
Hospital Activities
Acute hospitals
Definition:
This Sub-class includes medical, diagnostic and treatment activities of acute hospitals. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•hospital activities towards inpatients and are carried out under the direct supervision of medical doctors and includes services of:
- medical and paramedical staff
- laboratory and technical facilities, including radiologic and anaesthesiologic services
- emergency rooms
- provision of operating room services, pharmacy services, food and other hospital services

Description: Community hospitals
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of community hospitals.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•rehabilitative care
•intermediate medical care 
•sub-acute care

Description: Other hospitals n.e.c. (e.g. psychiatric hospital)
Definition: This Sub-class includes other hospitals not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•hospitals for infectious diseases
•family planning centres providing medical treatment such as sterilisation and termination of pregnancy, with accommodation
•maternity hospitals

Description: MEDICAL AND DENTAL PRACTICE ACTIVITIES
Medical and Dental Practice Activities
Clinics and other general medical services (Western)
Definition: This Sub-class includes medical consultation and treatment in the field of general medicine (Western). These activities can be carried out in private practices, group practices and in hospital outpatient clinics, and in clinics such as those attached to firms, schools, homes for the elderly, as well as in patients’ homes.

Description: Clinics and other general medical services (Non-Western)
Definition: This Sub-class includes medical consultation and treatment in the field of general medicine (Non-western). These activities can be carried out in private practices, group practices and in hospital outpatient clinics, and in clinics such as those attached to firms, schools, homes for the elderly, as well as in patients’ homes.

Description: Specialised medical services (including day surgical centres)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes other specialised medical services (without accommodation) by general practitioners and medical specialists and surgeons such as family planning, sterilisation and termination of pregnancy.

These activities can be carried out in private practices, group practices and in hospital outpatient clinics, and in clinics such as those attached to firms, schools, homes for the elderly, as well as in patients’ homes.

Description: Dental services
Definition: This Sub-class includes dental practice activities of a general or specialised nature (e.g. general dentistry, endodontics, periodontics, oral-maxillofacial surgery, prosthodontics, paediatric dentistry, orthodontics, dental implantology). These activities can be carried out in private practices, group practices and in hospital outpatient clinics, and in clinics such as those attached to firms, schools, homes for the elderly.

Description: OTHER HEALTH SERVICES
Other Health Services
Medical laboratories (e.g. blood analysis laboratories)
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of medical laboratories such as blood analysis laboratories.

Description: Medical diagnostic imaging centres (e.g. X-ray services)
Definition: This Sub-class includes activities of medical laboratories such as X-ray laboratories and other diagnostic imaging centres.

Description: Ambulance and medical evacuation services
Definition: This Sub-class includes units that transport patients by various modes (e.g. ground, air) along with medical care. The vehicles are equipped with lifesaving equipment operated by medically trained personnel.

Description: Home healthcare services
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of skilled nursing services in the home.

Description: Dialysis services
Definition: This Sub-class includes services of providing outpatient kidney or renal dialysis services.

Description: Other health services n.e.c. (excluding online marketplaces)
Definition: This Sub-class includes provision of other health services not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•other paramedical practitioners in the field of hydrotherapy, medical massage, chiropody, homeopathy, chiropractic, etc.
•blood banks, sperm banks, transplant organ banks, etc.

Description: RESIDENTIAL CARE SERVICES
RESIDENTIAL CARE SERVICES
Residential Nursing Care Facilities
Nursing and personal care facilities (including nursing homes and hospices)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of nursing care as an important element combined with residential care and supervisory or other types of care as required by the residents. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in activities of:
•homes for the elderly with nursing care
•convalescent homes
•rest homes with nursing care
•nursing care facilities
•nursing homes
•hospices

Description: Other Residential Care Services
Residential care services for the elderly (e.g. home for the aged)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of residential and personal care services for persons with some limits on ability for self-care, but where medical treatment or education are not important elements
•the care typically includes room, board, supervision, counselling (in some cases) and assistance in daily living, such as housekeeping services
•the activities may be carried out by public or private organisations

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•assisted-living facilities
•homes for the elderly with minimal nursing care
•rest homes without nursing care

Description: Residential care services for children (e.g. children’s homes, orphanages)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•the provision of residential and personal care services for children to ensure the needs of the children are met when they cannot live with their own family
•these services include providing a place for children to develop and grow, food, shelter and space for play and leisure
•the activities may be carried out by public or private organisations

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•orphanages
•children’s boarding homes and hostels

Description: Other residential care services n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes the provision of residential and personal care services for persons with some limits on ability for self-care or those who are unable to live with their family or independently, but where medical treatment or education are not important elements not elsewhere classified. The care typically includes room, board, supervision, counselling (in some cases) and assistance in daily living, such as housekeeping services. The activities may be carried out by public or private organisations.
Examples:
•halfway houses for substance abusers
•residential care services for persons with disabilities (physical disabilities, intellectual disabilities, sensory disabilities, etc.) and persons with mental health issues
•crisis shelter

Description: SOCIAL SERVICES WITHOUT ACCOMMODATION
SOCIAL SERVICES WITHOUT ACCOMMODATION FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED
Social Services Without Accommodation for the Elderly and Disabled
Social services for the elderly (e.g. befriender services, meal services, drop-in centres)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of non-residential social, counselling, welfare, referral and similar services which are aimed at the elderly in their homes or elsewhere and carried out by public or by private organisations, self-help, voluntary welfare organisations and by specialists providing counselling services.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•visiting of the elderly 
•day-care services for the elderly 
•meal services for the elderly

Description: Social services for persons with disabilities (e.g. day activity centres for people with disabilities)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of non-residential social, counselling, welfare, referral and similar services which are aimed at persons with disabilities. These services are provided in their homes or elsewhere and carried out by public or by private organisations, self-help, voluntary welfare organisations and by specialists providing counselling services.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in activities of:
•visiting of persons with disabilities 
•day-care services for persons with disabilities 
•meal services for persons with disabilities
•vocational training/rehabilitation and rehabilitation services for persons with disabilities provided that the education component is limited

Description: OTHER SOCIAL SERVICES WITHOUT ACCOMMODATION
Social Services Without Accommodation for Children, Youth and Families
Child care services for pre-school children (including infant care services)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the operation of day care centres of infant and pre-school children.

Units in this Sub-class generally care for infants and pre-school children, and may also offer pre-kindergarten or kindergarten educational program. 

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•child care service for pre-school children
•children’s crèche service
•infant care service
•children drop-off service
•babysitting services for infants and pre-school children by both agencies and own-account individuals

Description: Child/Student care services for school-going children (e.g. before and after-school care centres, student care centres)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•child/student care services for older school-going children by both agencies and own-account individual before or after school
•babysitting services for older school-going children by both agencies and own-account individual before or after school
•student care services for children with special needs

Description: Social services for children and youths (e.g. youth outreach services, adoption services)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•provision of non-residential social assistance services for children and youth. These firms provide for the welfare of children in such areas as adoption and foster care, drug prevention, life skills training, and positive social development.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•youth outreach service
•welfare and guidance services for children and adolescents
•child adoption services
•child fostering services

Description: Social services without accommodation for children, youth and families n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes establishments primarily engaged in social services without accommodation for children, youth and families not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•family service centre
•marriage and divorce counselling services (excluding those by psychology clinics)
•family welfare services

Description: Community Activities
Community development councils and grassroots organisations
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•community centres/clubs
•community development councils
•citizens’ consultative committees
•residential associations
•residents’ committees

Description: Social Services Without Accommodation n.e.c.
Job training and vocational rehabilitation services
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the provision of vocational rehabilitation services to unemployed or underemployed persons because of lack of education, job skill or experience.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following: 
•job counselling 
•job training
•vocational rehabilitation and rehabilitation services for unemployed persons provided that the education component is limited

Description: Charitable and other supporting activities aimed at humanitarian work
Definition: This Sub-class includes charitable activities like fund-raising or other charitable and other supporting activities aimed at humanitarian work.

Description: Other social services without accommodation n.e.c.
Definition: This Sub-class includes other social services without accommodation not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•community foundation
•psychology clinic
•credit and debt counselling services

Description: ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION
CREATIVE, ARTS AND ENTERTAINMENT ACTIVITIES
CREATIVE, ARTS AND ENTERTAINMENT ACTIVITIES
Creative, Arts and Entertainment Activities
Production of live stage presentations
Definition: This Sub-class includes production and participation in live theatrical presentations such as stage plays and musicals, theatre productions, operas, wayang and puppet shows.

Description: Performing arts venue operation
Definition: This Sub-class includes operation of performing arts venues (e.g. concert halls, theatre halls).

Description: Orchestras, musical bands, choirs and dance groups
Definition: This Sub-class includes groups primarily engaged in producing live musical entertainment (e.g. orchestras, musical bands, dance groups).

Description: Dramatic arts, music and other arts production-related activities n.e.c. (e.g. stage, lighting and sound services)
Definition: This Sub-class includes dramatic arts, music and other arts production-related activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•actor (own account)
•artist (own account)
•author (own account)

Description: LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, MUSEUMS AND OTHER CULTURAL ACTIVITIES
LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, MUSEUMS AND OTHER CULTURAL ACTIVITIES
Libraries and Archives Activities
Libraries and archives activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•documentation and information activities of libraries of all kinds, reading, listening and viewing rooms, public archives providing service to the general public or to a special clientele, such as students, scientists, staff, members as well as operation of government archives:
- organisation of a collection, whether specialised or not
- cataloguing collections
- lending and storage of books, maps, periodicals, films, records, tapes, works of art etc
- retrieval activities in order to service information requests, etc.
•stock photo libraries and services

Description: Museums Activities and Operation of Historical Sites and Buildings
Museums
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of museums of all kinds:
•art museums, museums of jewellery, furniture, costumes, ceramics, silverware
•natural history, science and technological museums, historical museums, including military museums
•other specialised museums
•open-air museums
•art galleries not for retail sale

Description: Preservation of historical sites, buildings, artefacts and paintings, cultural villages and other related activities n.e.c.
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the preservation of historical sites, buildings, artefacts and paintings, cultural villages and other related activities that are not elsewhere classified.
•operation of historical sites and buildings
•preservation of works of art and museum collection objects
•operation of cultural villages
Examples:
•operation of historical sites and buildings
•preservation of works of art and museum collection objects
•operation of cultural villages

Description: Botanical and Zoological Gardens and Nature Reserves Activities
Botanical and zoological gardens and nature reserves activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the operation of
•botanical or zoological gardens
•nature reserves

Description: GAMBLING AND BETTING ACTIVITIES
GAMBLING AND BETTING ACTIVITIES
Gambling and Betting Activities
Horse-racing and other betting activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•bookmaking and other betting operations
•off-track betting
•sale of lottery tickets
•operation of coin-operated gambling machines
•operation of virtual gambling web sites
•horse-racings

Description: Casinos
Definition: This Sub-class includes the operation of casinos with a range of gambling services such as table wagering games and poker/gaming machines. Also included are operation of floating casinos (i.e., gambling cruises, riverboat casinos).

Description: SPORTS ACTIVITIES AND AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION ACTIVITIES
SPORTS ACTIVITIES
Operation of Sports Facilities
Fitness centres and gymnasiums
Definition: This Sub-class includes fitness centres and gymnasiums which provide a range of fitness and exercise services. This also includes managing and providing the staff to operate these facilities.

Description: Operation of sports facilities n.e.c. (e.g. bowling alleys, tennis centres, billiard halls, football stadium)
Definition: This Sub-class includes units which operate sports facilities that are not elsewhere classified. This also includes managing and providing the staff to operate these facilities.
Examples:
•operation of facilities for indoor or outdoor sports events (open, closed or covered, with or without spectator seating):
- football and hockey stadiums
- swimming pools and stadiums
- track and field stadiums
- boxing arenas
- golf courses
- bowling alleys
•organisation and operation of outdoor or indoor sports events for professionals or amateurs by organisations with own facilities

Description: Activities of Sports Clubs/Associations and Related Activities
Activities of sports clubs/associations and related activities
Definition:
This Sub-class includes the activities of sports clubs and associations, which, whether professional, semi-professional or amateur clubs, give their members the opportunity to engage in sporting activities.

Units in this Sub-class are primarily engaged in one or more of the following:
•operation of clubs and associations for sports, such as:
- football
- bowling
- swimming
- golf
- boxing
- body-building
- track and field
- shooting
- chess
- contract bridge
•operation of martial arts and pugilistic clubs and associations
•operation of sports leagues and regulating bodies

Description: OTHER AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION ACTIVITIES
Other Amusement and Recreation Activities
Amusement theme parks
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of amusement parks or theme parks, including the operation of a variety of attractions, such as:
•mechanical rides
•water rides
•games
•shows
•theme exhibits
•picnic grounds

Description: Game arcade, online game aggregator, LAN game operators and gaming centres
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of: 
•game arcades
•simulation gaming 
•LAN games

Description: Night clubs, discotheques, dance clubs and karaoke lounges
Definition:
This Sub-class includes operation of: 
•discotheques 
•karaoke lounges

Description: Recreation clubs (including country clubs)
Definition: This Sub-class includes operation of recreation clubs (e.g. country clubs).

Description: Other amusement and recreation activities n.e.c. (including recreation parks/beaches and recreational fishing)
Definition: This Sub-class includes other amusement and recreation activities not elsewhere classified.
Examples:
•renting of leisure equipment as an integral part of recreational facilities
•fishing, recreational
•horse riding, recreational

Description: OTHER SERVICE ACTIVITIES
ACTIVITIES OF MEMBERSHIP ORGANISATIONS
ACTIVITIES OF BUSINESS, EMPLOYERS AND PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIP ORGANISATIONS
Activities of Business and Employers' Membership Organisations
Activities of business and employers' membership organisations
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•activities of organisations whose members’ interests centre on the development and prosperity of enterprises in a particular line of business or trade, including farming, or on the economic growth and climate of a particular geographical area or political sub-division without regard for the line of business
•activities of federations of such associations
•activities of chambers of commerce, guilds and similar organisations
•dissemination of information, representation before government agencies, public relations and labour negotiations of business and employer organisations

Description: Activities of Professional Membership Organisations
Activities of professional membership organisations (e.g. medical associations, law societies, accountancy bodies)
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•activities of organisations whose members’ interests centre chiefly on a particular scientific discipline, professional practice or technical field, such as medical associations, legal associations, accounting associations, engineering associations, architects associations 
•activities of associations of specialists engaged in cultural activities, such as associations of writers, painters, performers of various kinds, journalists
•dissemination of information, the establishment and supervision of standards of practice, representation before government agencies and public relations of professional organisations

Description: ACTIVITIES OF TRADE UNIONS
Activities of Trade Unions
Activities of trade unions
Definition:
This Sub-class includes:
•promoting of the interests of organised labour and union employees
•activities of associations whose members are employees interested chiefly in the representation of their views concerning the salary and work situation, and in concerted action through organisation
